name: Arcanist Spellcasting Increase
description: Your spellcasting level increases by 1. You learn new spells for your spellbook as detailed in your spellbook feature. You can take this perk multiple times, and each time you do so your spellcasting level increases by 1. You may not take this perk if it would cause your spellcasting level to be higher than your character level.

name: Signature Spell
description: Choose a 1st level and 2nd level spell that you know. These spells are always prepared for you, and you can cast them at their lowest levels as if they were cantrips.

name: Advanced Signature Spell
description:
Choose a 3rd level spell that you know. This spell is always prepared for you, and you can cast it at its lowest levels without expending a spell charge or spell points a number of times equal to your Spellcasting Modifier.

All expended uses of this ability recharge at the end of a Rest.

name: Improved Mage Armor
description: You can cast the spell Mage Armor as a cantrip, no longer requiring the expenditure of a spell charge or spell points. Additionally, when you cast the spell this way, it grants a defense bonus of +4 with no dexterity cap, and an Armor value of 2.

name: Tactician
description: You can give yourself a bonus to your initiative rolls equal to your Intelligence Modifier

name: Novice Abjurationist - Arcane Ward
description:
You have an arcane ward that protects you from harm. This ward has a number of hit points equal to your level + your Intelligence Modifier, which are refilled whenever you finish a Rest. Whenever you are hit by an attack or other damaging effect, your ward absorbs the damage instead. If this damage reduces the ward to 0 hit points, you take any remaining damage.

The ward does not share in any of your damage resistances.

Whenever you cast a spell of 1st level or higher, the ward regains a number of hit points equal to the level of the spell.

name: Advanced Abjurationist - Shield Refresh
requirements: Requires Novice Abjurationist - Arcane Ward, Level 5
description: Whenever you cast a spell, your ward gains additional hit points equal to _ your Intelligence Modifier (rounded up).

name: Expert Abjurationist - Spell Dampening
requirements: Requires Advanced Abjurationist - Shield Refresh, Level 7
description: You have resistance to all damage from spells.

name: Novice Conjurer - Conjurer's Step
description:
You can use an action to teleport yourself up to 30 feet to a location you can see. Alternatively, you can use two actions to target a willing ally within 30 feet and both teleport, magically swapping your positions. 

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence Modifier.

name: Advanced Conjurer - Stable Summons
requirements: Requires Novice Conjurer - Conjurer's Step, Level 5
description: Your summons spells no longer require concentration to maintain.

name: Expert Conjurer- Active Summons
requirements: Requires Advanced Conjurer - Stable Summons, Level 7
description: Your summons gain an extra action on each of their turns.

name: Novice Diviner - Portens
description: When you finish a Rest, roll two d20s and record the numbers rolled. You can replace any attack roll, saving throw, or ability check made by you or a creature that you can see with one of these foretelling rolls. You must choose to do so before the roll, and you can replace a roll in this way only once per turn. Each foretelling roll can be used only once. When you finish a Rest, you lose any unused foretelling rolls.

name: Advanced Diviner - 3rd Eye
description:
You can use your action to increase your powers of perception. When you do so, choose one of the following benefits, which lasts until you are incapacitated or you take a Rest. You can't use the feature again until you finish a Rest.

- Darkvision. You gain magical darkvision out to a range of 60 feet.

- Greater Comprehension. You can read any language.

- See Invisibility. You can see invisible creatures and objects within 10 feet of you that are within line of sight.

name: Expert Diviner - Advanced Portens
description: You roll three d20s for your Portens feature, rather than two.

name: Novice Enchanter - Hypnotic Gaze
description:
You can use two actions to force one target within 15 feet of you to make a Will saving throw or become Enthralled until the end of your next turn. A creature Enthralled with this effect has their speed reduced to 0, is incapacitated, and is visibly dazed and disoriented.

On each of your subsequent turns, you can use an action to extend the effect another turn. This effect lasts until you choose not to extend it, if you leave the 15 foot range of the ability, if the creature can no longer see or hear you, or if the creature takes damage.

Once the effect ends, or if the creature succeeds on the saving throw, they are immune to this effect for 24 hours, and you can't use this ability again until after your next Rest.

name: Advanced Enchanter - Deflecting Charm
requirements: Requires Novice Enchanter - Hypnotic Gaze, Level 5
description:
When a creature you can see within 30 feet makes an attack roll against you, you can use your reaction to force them to make a Will saving throw against your ability DC. On a failed save, the creature must target the creature closest to it (not including you or itself).

On a successful save, the attacker is immune to this effect for 24 hours.

You must choose to use this effect before knowing the results of the creature's attack roll.

name: Expert Enchanter - Alter Memories
requirements: Requires Advanced Enchanter - Deflecting Charm, Level 7
description: Whenever you use a spell or ability that Charms or Enthralls a creature, you can alter the creature's memories so it remains unaware of being charmed. Additionally, you can attempt to erase the target's memories of the time they were under your spell. The creature must succeed a Will saving throw against your Ability DC or lose a number of hours up to your Charisma Modifier (your choice) though the amount of time forgotten cannot exceed the length of time it was under your spell.

name: Novice Evoker - Protective Casting
description: When you cast a spell that targets an area, you can protect some of your allies inside the spells area of effect. Choose a number of allies up to your Intelligence Modifier (minimum 1), these allies automatically succeed on their saving throws against your spell.

name: Advanced Evoker - Potent Cantrips
requirements: Requires Novice Evoker - Protective Casting, Level 5
description: If you cast a cantrip that forces a target to make a saving throw, the target takes half damage on a successful saving throw rather than none. If your cantrip causes creatures to suffer additional effects, they still do not do so on a successful save.

name: Expert Evoker - Overchannel
requirements: Requires Advanced Evoker - Potent Cantrips, Level 7
description:
When you cast a spell of 5th level or lower that has a damage roll, you can overchannel the spell's power, causing it to do the maximum possible damage (you do not need to roll damage for it). The first time per day you do this, you suffer no ill effects. 

Each time after the first, you suffer 2d12 Dark damage per level of the spell. Each additional time you cast a spell after the second, the Dark damage increases by 1d12 per level of the spell.

name: Novice Illusionist - Improved Illusions
description:
If you don't already know it, you learn the cantrip Minor Illusion. Whenever you cast this cantrip, you can create both sound and an image as part of the same casting and maintain both using the same concentration.

Additionally, you can use an action to manipulate any illusion spell you cast to change its sound or image (within the spell's normal parameters for the illusion), though you must be able to see the illusion to do so.

name: Advanced Illusionist - Illusory Copy
requirements: Requires Novice Illusionist - Improved Illusions, Level 5
description:
You can create an illusory duplicate of yourself as an instant, almost instinctual reaction to danger. When a creature makes an attack roll against you, you can use your reaction to interpose the illusory duplicate between the attacker and yourself. The attack automatically misses you, then the illusion dissipates.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a Rest.

name: Expert Illusionist - Tangible Illusions
requirements: Requires Advanced Illusionist - Illusory Copy, Level 7
description:
Whenever you cast an illusion spell of 1st level or higher, you can choose one aspect of the illusion and make it real. Maintaining this object's realness requires its own concentration and Sustain a Spell action, but can otherwise the effect lasts as long as the spell does.

This illusion made real cannot deal damage or otherwise directly cause harm to anyone.

name: Novice Necromancer - Grim Harvest
description: When you kill an enemy with a spell of 1st level or higher, you regain hit points equal to 2 * the spells level + your spellcasting modifier.

name: Advanced Necromancer - Master of Thralls
requirements: Requires Novice Necromancer - Grim Harvest, Level 5
description: You learn the Summon Undead spell and always have it prepared if you must prepare your spells. When you cast Summon Undead, you summon an additional thrall as part of casting the spell. Additionally, each thrall you summon with the Summon Undead spell gains a number of hit points equal to your Level + your Intelligence Modifier.

name: Expert Necromancer - Command Undead
requirements: Requires Advanced Necromancer - Master of Thralls, Level 7
description:
You gain resistance to Dark damage, and can attempt to gain control of any undead you encounter.

Using two actions, you can force each Undead creature you can see within 30 feet to make a Will saving throw against your ability DC. If it succeeds, it is immune to this effect. If it fails, you gain control over it as if it was one of your thralls for 24 hours.

Intelligent undead are harder to control. If a targeted creature has an Intelligence of 8 or higher, they have advantage on the saving throw. If they have an intelligence of 12 or higher, they can repeat the saving throw every hour until it succeeds and breaks free.

name: Novice Transmuter - Transmuter's Stone
description:
You can spend 8 hours creating a transmuter's stone that stores transmutation magic. You can benefit from the stone yourself or give it to another creature. A creature gains a benefit of your choice as long as the stone is in the creature's possession. When you create the stone, choose the benefit from the following options:

- Darkvision out to a range of 60 feet

- An increase to their climbing, swimming, or walking speed of 10 feet while the creature is unencumbered. If the creature does not have a climbing or walking speed, they gain the relevant speed.

- Advantage on Fortitude saving throws

- Resistance to acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (your choice whenever you choose this benefit)

Each time you Rest, you can change the effect of your stone if the stone is on your person.

If you create a new transmuter's stone, the previous one ceases to function.

name: Advanced Transmuter - Shapechanger
requirements: Requires Novice Transmuter - Transmuter's Stone, Level 5
description:
You learn the Polymorph spell , or add it to your spellbook if it is not there already. You can cast Polymorph without expending a spell slot. When you do so, you can target only yourself.

Once you cast Polymorph in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a Rest, though you can still cast it normally using an available spell slot.

name: Expert Transmuter - Invoked Transmutation
description:
You can use an action to consume the reserve of transmutation magic stored within your transmuter's stone in a single burst. When you do so, choose one of the following effects. Your transmuter's stone is destroyed and can't be remade until you finish a Rest.

- Major Transformation. You can transmute one non-magical object - no larger than a 5-foot cube - into another non-magical object of similar size and mass and of equal or lesser value. You must spend 10 minutes handling the object to transform it.

- Panacea. You remove all curses, diseases, and poisons affecting a creature that you touch with the transmuter's stone. The creature also regains all its hit points and has all of its wounds removed.

- Restore Life. You cast the Raise Dead spell on a creature you touch with the transmuter's stone, without expending a spell slot or needing to have the spell in your spellbook.

- Restore Youth. You touch the transmuter's stone to a willing creature, and that creature's apparent age is reduced by 3d10 years, to a minimum of 13 years. This effect doesn't extend the creature's lifespan.

name: Occult Spellcasting Increase
description: Your spellcasting level increases by 1. You learn new spells as detailed in your Occult Casting feature. You can take this perk multiple times, and each time you do so your spellcasting level increases by 1. You may not take this perk if it would cause your spellcasting level to be higher than your character level.

name: Jack of All Trades
description: You can add _ your level (rounded up) to any skill check that you do not have at least Apprentice Proficiency in.

name: Countercharm
description: As two actions, you can start a performance that empowers your allies resolve against mental attacks. Until the start of your next turn, all allies (including yourself) within 30 feet can add your Performance Skill Proficiency to the result of their Will saving throws.

name: Master of Disguise
description:
You can cast the spell Disguise Self a number of times per day equal to your Charisma modifier. This action does not count as casting a spell for you. 

At 3rd level, you can cast the spell Alter Self as part of the same action and in the same way, creating even more elaborate disguises and illusions.

name: Cutting Words
description: When an enemy creature you can see makes a d20 roll, you can spend your reaction to roll one of your Bardic Inspiration dice and subtract the result from your enemies roll.

name: Novice College of Valor - Martial Inspiration
description: Allies who have one of your Bardic Inspiration die can use it in the additional following ways: They can use it to increase the result of a single damage roll from a weapon attack, or they can use it to increase their Defense against a single attack from an enemy.

name: Expert College of Valor - Cast and Slash
description: Whenever you cast a spell or cantrip using two or more actions, you can make a single weapon attack as part of that action.

name: Novice College of Whispers - Mind Blade
description: Once per round, when you hit an enemy with a weapon attack, you can expend a use of your Bardic Inspiration to do additional Psychic damage to your target. This damage is a number of d6s equal to _ your level (rounded up).

name: Advanced College of Whispers - Mantle of Shadow
requirements: Requires Novice College of Whispers - Mantle of Shadow, Level 5
description:
When a humanoid dies within 30 feet of you that you can see, you can magically capture their shadow as a reaction. You retain this shadow until you use it or until you Rest. 

As an action, you can consume the shadow to transform it into a disguise that appears on you. This disguise lasts for 1 hour, and while it lasts you appear to be the dead person, only alive and well. While appearing as this person, you have access to their surface level memories (no information deeper than what they would share with a casual acquaintance). Such information includes their general background and personal life, but does not include secrets or anything they would have attempted to conceal in life. 

This information is enough for you to pass yourself off as the person by drawing on their memories. Another creature can see through this disguise by succeeding on an Insight check contested by your Deception check. You have advantage on this contest roll. 

Once you capture a shadow with this feature, you cannot do so again until after a Rest.

name: Expert College of Whispers - Shadow Secrets
requirements: Requires Advanced College of Whispers - Shadow Secrets, Level 7
description:
As two actions, you can send a psychic whisper into the ear of a target you can see within 30 feet. The target must make a Will save against your Ability DC. If automatically succeeds the saving throw if it does not share a language with you. On a successful saving throw, the whisper sounds like an unintelligible mumble and has no effect.

On a failed saving throw, the target is Charmed by you for the next 8 hours, or until you or one of your allies takes hostile action towards it. It interprets these whispers as you knowing its most mortifying secret.

While you gain no knowledge of what this secret is, the target is convinced that you know it. While Charmed this way, the target obeys your commands for fear that you will reveal its secret.

It won't risk its life for you or fight for you unless otherwise inclined to do so. It grants you gifts and favors it would give a close friend. 

When the effect ends, the creature has no understanding of why it held you in such fear. 

You can only use this ability once per day.

name: Novice College of Glamour - Captivate
description:
You can begin an enthralling performance, captivating your audience with your skills and seductive fey magic. If you perform for at least one minute, you can expend a use of your Bardic Inspiration to target a number of humanoids (up to your Charisma modifier) within 30 feet and force them to make a Will saving throw against your Ability DC. If a target succeeds this saving throw, they suffer no effect, but are otherwise unaware that you tried to Charm them.

If a target fails this saving throw, they are Charmed by you for one hour and idolize you: it speaks glowingly of you to anyone who will listen, it hinders anyone who opposes you (though it will avoid violence unless otherwise inclined), and seeks to gain your favor.

This effect ends early if you take any hostile action towards it, or if it witnesses you taking hostile action towards one of its allies.

name: Advanced College of Glamour - Mantle of Majesty
requirements: Requires Novice College of Glamour - Captivate, Level 5
description:
Using two actions, you can assume a Mantle of Fey Majesty, cloaking yourself in illusions of Glamour and taking on an appearance of unearthly beauty for 1 minute. While in this state you can cast the spell Command without consuming any spell charges. Any creatures Charmed by you automatically fail the saving throw against your Command.

You can use this ability only once per day.

name: Expert College of Glamour - Deflecting Presence
requirements: Requires Advanced College of Glamour - Mantle of Majesty, Level 7
description:
Using two actions, you can assume a powerful fey presence for 1 minute or until you are incapacitated (whichever comes first). While in this state, any enemy who targets you with an attack must make a Will saving throw against your Ability DC. On a successful save, it has disadvantage on any spells you cast against it until the end of your next turn. On a failed save, it must choose a new target for its attack or lose the attack.

You can use this ability once per Rest.

name: Brutal Critical
description:
Whenever you make a damage roll for a critical hit with a melee weapon, you can increase the number of damage die rolled by 1.

Each time you take this feature, the number of extra dice you can roll increases by 1 (to a maximum of 3). You cannot take this feature a second time before level 4, or a 3rd time before level 7.

name: Danger Sense
description: You gain advantage on all Reflex saves against effects you can see, such as spells, traps, or other avoidable effects.

name: Feral Instincts
description: You have advantage on initiative rolls, and can use your rage ability as a reaction if an enemy is the one who initiated combat.

name: Reckless Attacks
description: You can throw aside all concern for defense to attack with fierce desperation. When you make your first attack on your turn, you can decide to attack recklessly. Doing so gives you advantage on melee weapon attack rolls using Strength during this turn, but attack rolls against you have advantage until your next turn.

name: Refuse Death
description: When you are reduced to 0 hit points, you can make a DC 15 Fortitude saving throw to remain at 1 hit point instead. Each time you succeed at this saving throw, the DC increases by 5 and you gain a wound.

name: Resourceful
description: Choose two skills from the following: Athletics, Medicine, Nature, Perception, Society, Stealth, or Survival. You gain two skill increases to each of those skills.

name: Titan Mauler
description: You can wield a two-handed weapon in one hand. You can't wield two weapons in this way.

name: Novice Berserker - Furious Flurry
description: While you are raging, your attacks do not suffer the multi-attack penalty.

name: Advanced Berserker - Mindless Rage
requirements: Requires Novice Berserker - Furious Flurry, Level 3
description: While raging, you become a mindless vessel of violence. You have advantage on all will saving throws and are immune to being charmed or frightened while under the effects of your rage.

name: Expert Berserker - Strike Back
requirements: Requires Advanced Berserker - Mindless Rage, Level 7
description: Whenever a creature in your reach deals damage to you, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against that creature.

name: Novice Immolator - Fire Storm
description:
While you are raging, you have resistance to fire damage and exude an aura of fire. This aura extends out 10 feet from you in all directions. Each creature inside your aura (including yourself) takes Fire damage equal to your Constitution modifier at the beginning of each of their turns.

Additionally, the additional rage damage you add to each of your attacks becomes Fire damage instead of your weapon's type.

name: Advanced Immolator - Controlled Burn
requirements: Requires Novice Immolator - Fire Storm, Level 3
description: You gain further control over your aura, and its radius extends to 15 feet. Additionally, you can partially protect your allies from the intense heat, granting them resistance to Fire damage (both from your aura and outside sources) while they are inside its radius.

name: Expert Immolator - Wrath of the Inferno
requirements: Requires Advanced Immolator - Controlled Burn, Level 7
description: You have mastered the element of fire, and its radius extends to 20 feet total. You gain the ability to channel its power against your foes directly: As a single action, you can force an enemy inside the aura to take the full power of your fury. This enemy must make a Reflex saving throw against your Ability DC or take 3d8 Fire damage. This damage increases to 4d8 at level 10. You can only use this action once per round.

name: Novice Storm Caller - Bring the Storm
description: Whenever you enter your rage, you summon a small storm to surround you on the battlefield. Once on each of your turns as an action, you can evoke the storm to force one enemy within 10 feet of you to make a Reflex saving throw. On a failed save your target takes 2d6 Lightning damage, or half as much on a successful save. This damage increases to 3d6 at 4th level and 4d6 at 8th level.

name: Advanced Storm Caller - Storm's Answer
requirements: Requires Novice Storm Caller - Bring the Storm, Level 3
description: While you are raging, the storm punishes those who would stand against you. Whenever you are damaged by an enemy within 30 feet of you, you can use your reaction to force that enemy to make a Reflex saving throw. On a failed save your target takes 2d8 Lightning damage, or half as much on a successful save. This damage increases to 3d8 at 5th level and 4d8 at 9th level.

name: Expert Storm Caller - Lightning Call
requirements: Requires Advanced Storm Caller - Storm's Answer, Level 7
description: You master the storm around you, and can summon its full might to destroy your enemies. Whenever you enter a rage, you create a bolt of lightning that arcs toward a target of your choice that you can see within 60 feet. Three bolts then leap from that target to as many as three other targets, each of which must be within 30 feet of the first target. A target can be a creature or an object and can be targeted by only one of the bolts. A target must make a Dexterity saving throw. The target takes 10d8 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

name: Novice Warlord - Empowering Presence
description: Your presence inspires your allies and emboldens them forward. While you are raging, the aura of your presence extends in a 15 foot radius around you. You and each of your allies within the aura gain a number of temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier at the start of their turn.

name: Advanced Warlord - Force of Will
requirements: Requires Novice Warlord - Empowering Presence, Level 3
description: The force of your presence carries through into your attacks. You can add your charisma modifier to the damage rolls of any melee weapon attacks you make.

name: Expert Warlord - Fear and Awe
requirements: Requires Advanced Warlord - Force of Will, Level 7
description: You are a master of the battlefield, and your presence weakens the resolve of your enemies. The radius of your presence aura increases to 20 feet. Whenever an enemy enters the aura, or begins their turn inside it, they must succeed at a Will saving throw or subtract your Charisma modifier from any attacks or saving throws they make while inside the aura until the beginning of their next turn.

name: Champion Spellcasting Increase
description: Your spellcasting level increases by 1. You can take this perk multiple times, and each time you do so your spellcasting level increases by 1. You may not take this perk if it would cause your spellcasting level to be higher than your character level.

name: Aura of Courage and Devotion
description: You, and all allies within 10 feet of you have advantage against being Frightened, Fear effects, as well as against being Charmed while you are conscious. This aura extends to 30 feet at 10th level.

name: Aura of Glory
description: When you or an ally within 10 feet of you score a critical hit or kill an enemy, they gain your Charisma modifier in temporary hit points. This aura extends to 30 feet at 10th level.

name: Aura of Protection
description: You, and all allies within 10 feet of you, may add your Charisma Modifier to the result of their saving throws while you are conscious. This aura extends to 30 feet at 10th level.

name: Aura of Sacrifice
description: When an ally within 10 feet of you is damaged, you can magically redirect half that damage to yourself. This ability's range extends to 30 feet at 10th level.

name: Aura of Warding
description: You, and all allies within 10 feet of you, may subtract your Charisma Modifier from any damage they would take from a spell. This aura extends to 30 feet at 10th level.

name: Purification
description: You can spend two actions to end a single spell currently affecting a target you can touch. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier each day.

name: Retributive Strike
description: When one of your allies is damaged by an enemy and their attacker is within melee range of you, you can spend your reaction to make a single melee attack against that enemy.

name: Oath of the Sentinel Spells
description: At each of the spellcasting levels listed on the Oath Spells chart below, you learn the spells listed. These spells are always prepared for you (if you are a caster that prepares spells), and do not count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. These spells are Divine Spells for you.
5thLevelSpells: Commune with Nature, Wrath of Nature

name: Novice Oath of the Sentinel - Nature's Wrath
description:
Using two actions, you can cause spectral vines to spring up and reach for a creature within 20 feet of you that you can see. The creature must succeed on a Fortitude or Reflex saving throw (its choice) or be restrained. While restrained by the vines, the creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a success, it frees itself and the vines vanish.

You can use this ability once per day.

name: Advanced Oath of the Sentinel - Undying Sentinel
requirements: Requires Novice Oath of the Sentinel - Nature's Wrath, Level 5
description:
When you are reduced to 0 hit points and are not killed outright, you can choose to drop to 1 hit point instead. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a Rest.

Additionally, you suffer none of the drawbacks of old age, and you can't be aged magically.

name: Expert Oath of the Sentinel - Elder Champion
requirements: Requires Advanced Oath of the Sentinel - Undying Sentinel, Level 10
description:
Using two actions, you undergo a transformation assuming the form of an ancient force of nature. For 1 minute, you gain the following benefits:

- At the start of each of your turns, you regain 10 hit points.

- Whenever you cast a spell that has a casting time of 2 or 3 actions, you can reduce its casting time by 1 action.

- Enemy creatures within 10 feet of you have disadvantage on saving throws against your spells and Nature's Wrath.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a Rest.

name: Oath of the Conqueror Spells
description: At each of the spellcasting levels listed on the Oath Spells chart below, you learn the spells listed. These spells are always prepared for you (if you are a caster that prepares spells), and do not count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. These spells are Divine Spells for you.

name: Novice Oath of the Conqueror - Strike Fear
description:
Using two actions, you force each creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you to make a Will saving throw. On a failed save, a creature becomes frightened of you for 1 minute. The frightened creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

You can use this ability once per day.

name: Advanced Oath of the Conqueror - Scornful Rebuke
requirements: Requires Novice Oath of the Conqueror - Strike Fear, Level 5
description: Whenever a creature hits you with an attack, that creature takes Psychic damage equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1) if you're not incapacitated.

name: Expert Oath of the Conqueror - Invincible Conqueror
requirements: Requires Advanced Oath of the Conqueror - Scornful Rebuke, Level 10
description:
Using two actions, you harness extraordinary martial prowess. For 1 minute, you gain the following benefits:

- You have resistance to all damage.

- Whenever you spend an action to make an attack, you can make a second attack as part of that action using the same multi-attack penalty.

- Your critical threshold is decreased by 1.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a Rest.

name: Oath of the Protector Spells
description: At each of the spellcasting levels listed on the Oath Spells chart below, you learn the spells listed. These spells are always prepared for you (if you are a caster that prepares spells), and do not count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. These spells are Divine Spells for you.
4thLevelSpells: Aura of Life, Guardian of Faith

name: Novice Oath of the Protector - Champion's Challenge
description:
As an action, you issue a challenge that compels other creatures to do battle with you. Each creature of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you must make a Will saving throw. On a failed save, a creature can't willingly move more than 30 feet away from you. This effect ends on the creature if you are incapacitated or die or if you move more than 30 feet away from the creature.

You can use this ability once per day.

name: Advanced Oath of the Protector - Unbreakable Protector
requirements: Requires Novice Oath of the Protector - Champion's Challenge, Level 5
description: You have advantage on saving throws to avoid becoming paralyzed or stunned

name: Expert Oath of the Protector - Champion of the People
requirements: Requires Advanced Oath of the Protector - Unbreakable Protector, Level 10
description:
Using an action, you inspire those around you. For 1 minute, you gain the following benefits:

- You gain resistance to bludgeoning, slashing, and piercing damage

- Your allies within 30 feet have advantage on death saving throws, and do not suffer wounds when they are stabilized or healed.

- You and all allies within 30 feet have advantage on Will saving throws.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a Rest.

name: Oath of the Devoted Spells
description: At each of the spellcasting levels listed on the Oath Spells chart below, you learn the spells listed. These spells are always prepared for you (if you are a caster that prepares spells), and do not count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. These spells are Divine Spells for you.
4thLevelSpells: Freedom of Movement, Guardian of Faith

name: Novice Oath of the Devoted - Holy Blade
description: Your weapon is infused with the might of your belief. Your weapon becomes a Flaming Weapon: As a free action, you may command it to ignite. It will become engulfed in flames, dealing an extra damage die of Fire damage and emitting bright light for 10 feet, and dim light for an additional 10 feet. The number of extra fire damage dice increases by 1 at 5th and 9th level. Additionally, you can add your Charisma modifier to attack rolls with this weapon.

name: Advanced Oath of the Devoted - Blessed and Bound
requirements: Requires Novice Oath of the Devotion - Holy Blade, Level 5
description: You are always under the effects of a Protection from the Unnatural spell.

name: Expert Oath of the Devoted - Holy Radiance
requirements: Requires Advanced Oath of the Devotion - Blessed and Bound, Level 10
description:
Using two actions, you emulate an aura of sunlight. For 1 minute, emit bright light in a 30 foot radius, and dim light an additional 30 feet beyond that.

- Whenever an enemy creature starts its turn in the bright light, they take 10 Light damage.

- Whenever an allied creature starts their turn in the bright light, they are healed for your Charisma Modifier in hit points.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a Rest.

name: Oath of the Hero Spells
description: At each of the spellcasting levels listed on the Oath Spells chart below, you learn the spells listed. These spells are always prepared for you (if you are a caster that prepares spells), and do not count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. These spells are Divine Spells for you.

name: Novice Oath of the Hero - Heroic Fury
description:
Using an action, you empower your strikes with Heroic Fury. For 1 minute, your critical threshold is decreased by 1.

You can use this ability once per day.

name: Advanced Oath of the Hero - Glorious Defense
requirements: Requires Novice Oath of the Hero - Heroic Fury, Level 5
description:
When a creature you can see hits you with an attack roll, you can use your reaction to gain a bonus to Defense against that attack, potentially causing it to miss you.

The bonus equals your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1). If the attack misses, you can make one weapon attack against the attacker as part of this reaction.

name: Expert Oath of the Hero - Living Myth
requirements: Requires Advanced Oath of the Hero - Glorious Defense, Level 10
description:
Using an action, you embody the legends told about yourself both true and exaggerated. For 1 minute, you gain the following benefits:

- You have advantage on all Charisma based Skill Checks.

- Once on each of your turns when you miss with a melee weapon attack, you can choose to hit instead

- If you fail a saving throw, you can spend your reaction to choose to succeed instead.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a Rest.

name: Oath of the Avenger Spells
description: At each of the spellcasting levels listed on the Oath Spells chart below, you learn the spells listed. These spells are always prepared for you (if you are a caster that prepares spells), and do not count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. These spells are Divine Spells for you.

name: Novice Oath of the Avenger - Force of Enmity
description:
Using an action, you can utter a vow of enmity against a creature you can see within 10 feet of you. You gain advantage on attack rolls against the creature for 1 minute or until it drops to 0 hit points or falls unconscious.

You can use this ability once per day.

name: Advanced Oath of the Avenger - Provoking Vow
requirements: Requires Novice Oath of the Avenger - Force of Enmity, Level 5
description: When a creature under the effect of your Vow of Enmity makes an attack, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against that creature if it is within reach.

name: Expert Oath of the Avenger - Avenging Angel
requirements: Requires Advanced Oath of the Avenger - Provoking Vow, Level 10
description:
Using two actions, you take the form of an avenging angel. For 1 minute, you gain the following benefits:

- You manifest glowing wings from your back and gain a flying speed of 60 feet.

- You emanate an aura of menace in a 30-foot radius. The first time any enemy creature enters the aura or starts its turn there during a battle, the creature must succeed on a Will saving throw or become frightened of you for 1 minute or until it takes any damage. Attack rolls against the frightened creature have advantage.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a Rest.

name: Bloodline Spellcasting Increase
description: Your spellcasting level increases by 1. You learn new spells as detailed in your Bloodline Spellcasting feature. You can take this perk multiple times, and each time you do so your spellcasting level increases by 1. You may not take this perk if it would cause your spellcasting level to be higher than your character level.

name: Bend Luck
description: When another creature you can see makes an attack roll, an ability check, or a saving throw, you can use your reaction and spend 2 Spell Points to roll 1d4 and apply the number rolled as a bonus or penalty (your choice) to the creature's roll. You can do so after the creature rolls but before any effects of the roll occur.

name: Metamagic
description: You learn 2 additional metamagic abilitis from the Metamagics list. You can take this ability any number of times. Each time you take this feature your maximum Spell Points is increased by 4. If you do not already have a pool of Spell Points, you gain a pool of 4 Spell Points that can only be used for metamagics or other non-spell identity features. This pool refills at the end of each Rest.

name: Bottomless Wellspring
description: When you start a combat encounter and do not have any spell points remaining, you regain your level + your Casting modifier in spell points

name: Divine Bloodline Spells
description: At each of the spellcasting levels listed on the Bloodline Spells chart below, you learn the spells listed. These spells are always prepared for you (if you are a caster that prepares spells), and do not count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. These spells are of the same type as your bloodline.
3rdLevelSpells: Beacon of Hope, Mass Healing Word

name: Novice Divine Bloodline - Blessed Influence
description: Up to once per turn, whenever you or an ally within 5 feet of you rolls dice to determine the number of hit points a spell restores, you can spend 1 spell point to reroll any number of those dice once, provided you aren't incapacitated.

name: Advanced Divine Bloodline - Angelic Flight
requirements: Requires Novice Divine Bloodline - Blessed Influence, Level 6
description: You can use a single action to manifest a pair of spectral wings from your back. While the wings are present, you have a flying speed of 30 feet. The wings last until you're incapacitated, you die, or you dismiss them as an action. You can choose the wings appearance.

name: Expert Divine Bloodline - Divine Rebirth
requirements: Requires Advanced Divine Bloodline - Angelic Flight, Level 9
description:
As an action when you have fewer than half of your hit points remaining, you can regain a number of hit points equal to half your hit point maximum.

You can use this ability once per day

name: Draconic Bloodline Spells
description: At each of the spellcasting levels listed on the Bloodline Spells chart below, you learn the spells listed. These spells are always prepared for you (if you are a caster that prepares spells), and do not count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. These spells are of the same type as your bloodline.

name: Novice Draconic Bloodline - Ancestral Influence
description: When you cast a spell that deals damage of the type associated with your draconic ancestry, add your Charisma modifier to that damage. At the same time, you can spend 1 sorcery point to gain resistance to that damage type for 1 hour.

name: Advanced Draconic Bloodline - Draconic Flight
requirements: Requires Novice Draconic Bloodline - Ancestral Influence, Level 6
description:
You gain the ability to sprout a pair of dragon wings from your back, gaining a flying speed equal to your current walking speed. You can create these wings as an action on your turn. They last until you dismiss them as an action.

You can't manifest your wings while wearing armor unless the armor is made to accommodate them, and clothing not made to accommodate your wings might be destroyed when you manifest them.

name: Expert Draconic Bloodline - Behold the Dragon
requirements: Requires Advanced Draconic Bloodline - Draconic Flight, Level 9
description:
As an action, you can spend 5 spell points to draw on the draconic power in your blood and exude an aura of awe or fear (your choice) to a distance of 60 feet. For 1 minute or until you lose your concentration (as if you were casting a concentration spell), each hostile creature that starts its turn in this aura must succeed on a Will saving throw or be charmed (if you chose awe) or frightened (if you chose fear) until the aura ends.

A creature that succeeds on this saving throw is immune to your aura for 24 hours.

name: Profane Bloodline Spells
description: At each of the spellcasting levels listed on the Bloodline Spells chart below, you learn the spells listed. These spells are always prepared for you (if you are a caster that prepares spells), and do not count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. These spells are of the same type as your bloodline.

name: Novice Profane Bloodline - Living Shadow
description:
Your existence in a twilight state between life and death makes you difficult to defeat. When damage reduces you to 0 hit points, you can make a Will saving throw (DC 5 + the damage taken). On a success, you instead drop to 1 hit point. You can't use this feature if you are reduced to 0 hit points by Light damage or by a critical hit.

Once you succeed on this saving throw, you can't attempt to do so again until after your next Rest.

name: Advanced Profane Bloodline - Shadow Step
requirements: Requires Novice Profane Bloodline - Living Shadow, Level 6
description: You gain the ability to step from one shadow into another. When you are in dim light or darkness, as an action, you can teleport up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space you can see that is also in dim light or darkness.

name: Expert Profane Bloodline - Become the Shadow
requirements: Requires Advanced Profane Bloodline - Shadow Step, Level 9
description: You can spend 6 spell points as an action to transform yourself into a shadowy form. In this form, you have resistance to all damage except Arcane and Light damage, and you can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. You take 5 arcane damage if you end your turn inside an object. You remain in this form for 1 minute. It ends early if you are incapacitated, if you die, or if you dismiss it as a free action.

name: Storm Spirit Bloodline Spells
description: At each of the spellcasting levels listed on the Bloodline Spells chart below, you learn the spells listed. These spells are always prepared for you (if you are a caster that prepares spells), and do not count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. These spells are of the same type as your bloodline.

name: Novice Storm Spirit Bloodline - Invoke the Storm
description: You gain resistance to lightning and thunder damage. In addition, whenever you start casting a spell of 1st level or higher that deals lightning or thunder damage, stormy magic erupts from you. This eruption causes creatures of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of you to take lightning or thunder damage (choose each time this ability activates) equal to your sorcerer level.

name: Advanced Storm Spirit Bloodline - Static Charge
requirements: Requires Novice Storm Spirit Bloodline - Invoke the Storm, Level 6
description: When you are hit by a melee attack, you can use your reaction to deal lightning damage to the attacker. The damage equals your level. The attacker must also make a Fortitude saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker is pushed in a straight line up to 20 feet away from you.

name: Expert Storm Spirit Bloodline - Storm's Flight
requirements: Requires Advanced Storm Spirit Bloodline - Static Charge, Level 9
description:
You gain immunity to lightning and thunder damage.

You also gain a magical flying speed of 60 feet. Using two actions, you can reduce your flying speed to 30 feet for 1 hour and choose a number of creatures within 30 feet of you equal to your Charisma modifier. The chosen creatures gain a magical flying speed of 30 feet for 1 hour. Once you reduce your flying speed in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a Rest.

name: Psion Bloodline Spells
description: At each of the spellcasting levels listed on the Bloodline Spells chart below, you learn the spells listed. These spells are always prepared for you (if you are a caster that prepares spells), and do not count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. These spells are of the same type as your bloodline.

name: Novice Psion Bloodline - Subtle Casting
description:
When you cast any of your Bloodline Spells, they require no verbal or somatic components.

Additionally, you gain resistance to psychic damage, and you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened

name: Advanced Psion Bloodline - Psionic Warp
requirements: Requires Novice Psion Bloodline - Subtle Casting, Level 6
description:
You can unleash your Psionic power as a space-warping anomaly. Using two actions, you can teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 120 feet of you. Immediately after you disappear, each creature within 30 feet of the space you left must make a Fortitude saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 3d10 Arcane damage and is pulled straight toward the space you left, ending in an unoccupied space as close to your previous space as possible. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pulled.

Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until after you Rest, or unless you spend 5 spell points to use it again.

name: Expert Psion Bloodline - Mass Mind Reader
requirements: Requires Advanced Psion Bloodline - Psionic Warp, Level 9
description: Using two actions, you can open your mind and read the thoughts and plans of those around you. For 1 minute, you gain advantage on any Persuasion or Insight skill checks to interact with NPCs. If you are in combat, you gain advantage on all attack rolls against enemies within 30 feet, and all enemies within 30 feet have disadvantage on attack rolls against you and on Reflex saving throws from spells you cast.

name: Astral Protection
description: As a reaction or single action, you can spend 4 ki points to turn invisible for 1 minute. While invisible, you have resistance to all damage except arcane damage. If you take any hostile action, the invisibility ends early.

name: Deflect Missiles
description:
You can use your reaction to deflect or catch the missile when you are hit by a ranged weapon attack. When you do so, the damage you take from the attack is reduced by your martial arts dice + your Dexterity modifier + your Wisdom modifier + your level.

If you reduce the damage to 0, you can catch the missile as long as it is small enough for you to hold in one hand and you have at least one hand free. If you catch a missile in this way, make a ranged attack with a range of 20/60 using the weapon or piece of ammunition you just caught, as part of the same reaction.

You are proficient with this attack, and can use your Dexterity modifier for both the attack roll and damage calculation.

name: Flexibility of Mind
description: Whenever you begin a combat encounter and don't have any Ki points remaining, you immediately regain a number of ki points equal to your Wisdom Modifier.

name: Ki-Touched Mind
description: You can spend a single ki point to expand your mind to understand others. For 1 hour, you understand all spoken languages, so long as you are within 30 feet of someone who speaks that language. Additionally, anyone within 30 feet of you can understand you, so long as there is a language that they understand.

name: Slow Fall
description: You can spend your reaction to magically slow your descent during a fall, reducing any fall damage you take by 5 * your level.

name: Stunning Strike
description: When you hit an enemy with an unarmed attack, you can spend a single ki point to force them to make a Fortitude saving throw or be stunned until the end of your next turn.

name: Unarmed Momentum
description: When you take the attack action and make an unarmed attack, you can make a second attack as part of the same action. These strikes count as a single attack for the purpose of determining your multiple attack modifier. If you have the Flurry of Blows special ability, the number of attacks you can make with that ability increases to 3.

name: Novice Drunken Master - Drunken Wanderer
description:
You gain a skill increase to Performance.

Whenever you use your Flurry of Blows ability, you can take the Step ability as part of the same action.

name: Advanced Drunken Master - Lucky Bounce
requirements: Requires Novice Drunken Master - Drunken Wanderer, Ki, Level 3
description: When you make an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw and have disadvantage on the roll, you can spend 2 ki points to negate the disadvantage for the roll.

name: Expert Drunken Master - A Round for Everyone
requirements: Requires Advanced Drunken Master - Lucky Bounce, Level 5
description: When you use your Flurry of Blows, you can make up to three additional attacks with it, provided that you target a single creature with no more than two strikes of the flurry.

name: Novice Kensei - Agile Parry
description:
You gain a skill increase to Society.

When you are wielding a weapon, if you have a martial arts dice, you can choose to use that dice in place of your weapon's normal damage dice.

If you are wielding a weapon in one hand and make an unarmed strike as a part of your turn, you gain a +2 bonus to Defense until the start of your next turn.

name: Advanced Kensei - Martial Disciple
requirements: Requires Novice Kensei - Agile Parry, Ki, Martial Arts, Level 3
description: When you make an attack with a weapon you are proficient with, you can spend a ki point to add your martial arts dice to the damage roll of the attack.

name: Expert Kensei - Preserved Momentum
requirements: Requires Advanced Kensei - Martial Disciple, Level 6
description: Once per turn when you miss an attack with a weapon or unarmed strike, you can reroll the attack.

name: Novice Open Hand - Manipulative Strikes
description:
Whenever you hit a creature with one of the attacks granted by your Flurry of Blows, you can impose one of the following effects on that target:

- It must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone.

- It must make a Strength saving throw. If it fails, you can push it up to 15 feet away from you.

- It can't take reactions until the end of your next turn.

name: Advanced Open Hand - Peaceful Wanderer
requirements: Requires Novice Open Hand - Manipulative Strikes, Level 3
description: At the start of each day, you take on an aura of tranquility. Until you take a hostile action, any creature that wishes to attack you or target you with a spell must first make a Will saving throw. On a failed save, they must choose a new target or lose the attack or ability. On a successful save they are immune to this effect for 24 hours.

name: Expert Open Hand - Quivering Palm
requirements: Requires Advanced Open Hand - Peaceful Wanderer, Level 6
description:
When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can spend 3 ki points to start imperceptible lethal vibrations in your target's body, which last for a number of days equal to your level. The vibrations are harmless unless you use your action to end them. To do so, you and the target must be on the same plane of existence. When you use this action, the creature must make a Fortitude saving throw. If it fails, it is reduced to 0 hit points. If it succeeds, it takes 10d10 Dark damage.

You can have only one creature under the effect of this feature at a time. You can choose to end the vibrations harmlessly without using an action.

name: Novice Shadow - Fade into Darkness
description:
Using two actions, you can spend 2 ki points to cast Darkness, Darkvision, Unnoticeable, or Silence, without providing material components.

Additionally, you gain the Minor Illusion cantrip if you don't already know it.

name: Advanced Shadow - Linked Shadows
requirements: Requires Novice Shadow - Fade into Darkness, Level 3
description:
When you are in dim light or darkness, you can use a single action to teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see that is also in dim light or darkness. You then have advantage on the first melee attack you make before the end of the turn.

Additionally, When you are in an area of dim light or darkness, you can use two actions to become invisible. You remain invisible until you make an attack, cast a spell, or are in an area of bright light.

name: Expert Shadow - And One from Me
requirements: Requires Advanced Shadow - Linked Shadows, Level 6
description: Whenever a creature within 5 feet of you is hit by an attack made by a creature other than you, you can use your reaction to make a melee attack against that creature.

name: Novice Sun Soul - Flaming Fists
description: You gain a new attack option that you can use whenever you make an unarmed attack. This special attack is a ranged spell attack with a range of 30 feet. You are proficient with it, and you add your Dexterity modifier to its attack and damage rolls. It deals Light damage equal to the damage you would deal with an unarmed attack.

name: Advanced Sun Soul - Summon the Sun
requirements: Requires Novice Sun Soul - Flaming Fists, Ki, Level 3
description:
You gain the ability to create an orb of light that erupts into a devastating explosion. Using two actions, you magically create an orb and hurl it at a point you choose within 150 feet, where it erupts into a sphere of radiant light for a brief but deadly instant.

Each creature in that 20-foot-radius sphere must succeed on a Fortitude saving throw or take 2d6 Light damage. A creature doesn't need to make the save if the creature is behind total cover.

You can increase the sphere's damage by spending ki points. Each point you spend, up to a maximum of 3, increases the damage by 2d6.

name: Expert Sun Soul - Radiant Glow
requirements: Requires Advanced Sun Soul - Summon the Sun, Level 6
description:
You shed bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. You can extinguish or restore the light as a single action.

If a creature hits you with a melee attack while this light shines, you can use your reaction to deal Light damage to the creature. The Light damage equals your level + your Wisdom modifier.

name: Priest Spellcasting Increase
description: Your spellcasting level increases by 1. You can take this perk multiple times, and each time you do so your spellcasting level increases by 1. You may not take this perk if it would cause your spellcasting level to be higher than your character level.

name: Cast Down
description: When you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that targets a single enemy, if the attack is successful or if they fail the saving throw they must make a Fortitude saving throw or be knocked prone.

name: Divine Strike
description: Whenever you hit an enemy with a melee attack or cantrip, they take additional damage equal to your Wisdom modifier.

name: Eternal Blessing
description: You have an aura of divine blessing that extends in a 15 foot radius around you. Any ally inside this aura can add 1d4 to any attack roll, ability check, or saving throw.

name: Powerful Healer
description: Whenever you heal an ally with your font of healing, you gain hit points equal to your Wisdom Modifier. Additionally whenever you cast a healing spell, the size of all its healing dice are increased by 1.

name: Snatched from the Grave
description: When an ally dies from damage or from failing death saves, you can use your reaction and expend a use of your Font of Healing to return them to life with 1 hit point and 3 wounds.

name: Arcana Domain Spells
description: At each of the spellcasting levels listed on the Domain Spells chart below, you learn the spells listed. These spells are always prepared for you (if you are a caster that prepares spells), and do not count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. These spells are Divine Spells for you.

name: Novice Arcana Domain - Arcane Initiate
description: You gain a skill increase in the arcana skill, and learn a cantrip of your choice from the Arcane Spell List. If you are already proficient in a form of spellcasting, this cantrip is of that spellcasting type for you.

name: Advanced Arcana Domain - Purging Heals
requirements: Requires Novice Arcana Domain - Arcane Initiate, Level 4
description: When you cast a Healing spell on yourself or an ally, you can cast Dispel Magic on them as part of the casting of the Heal without expending a spell charge or spell points.

name: Advanced Arcana Domain - Expansive Knowledge
requirements: Requires Novice Arcana Domain - Arcane Initiate, Spellcasting, Level 5
description: You learn a number of spells from the Arcane spell list equal to your spellcasting level, these spells are always prepared for you, and don't count against the number of spells you can prepare. Each time your spellcasting level increases, you learn an additional spell from the Arcane spell list. This spell must be of a level less than or equal to your Spellcasting Level, and must be prepared as normal.

name: Creation Domain Spells
description: At each of the spellcasting levels listed on the Domain Spells chart below, you learn the spells listed. These spells are always prepared for you (if you are a caster that prepares spells), and do not count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. These spells are Divine Spells for you.

name: Novice Creation Domain - Empowered Weapon
description: During the end of each Rest, you can spend an hour and imbue a single weapon with power to grant it +1 to attack rolls and 2x its base weapon damage dice.

name: Advanced Creation Domain - Fire Hardened Plates
requirements: Requires Novice Creation Domain - Empowered Weapon, Level 4
description: You gain resistance to fire damage, and gain +1 Defense and Armor while wearing heavy armor

name: Expert Creation Domain - Saint of the Forge
requirements: Requires Advanced Creation Domain - Fire Hardened Plates, Level 9
description: You are immune to fire damage, and while wearing heavy armor have resistance to bludgeoning, slashing, and piercing damage.

name: Death Domain Spells
description: At each of the spellcasting levels listed on the Domain Spells chart below, you learn the spells listed. These spells are always prepared for you (if you are a caster that prepares spells), and do not count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. These spells are Divine Spells for you.

name: Novice Death Domain - Epidemic Necromancy
description: You learn a necromancy cantrip of your choice from any spell list. In addition, whenever you cast a necromancy spell, you may have that spell target an additional target, provided that both targets are within range.

name: Advanced Death Domain - Corrupting Spells
requirements: Requires Novice Death Domain - Epidemic Necromancy, Level 4
description: Whenever you hit an enemy with a damaging spell or effect, you can cause the damage dealt to be Dark damage instead of its original damage type.

name: Expert Death Domain - Feast on the Dark
requirements: Requires Advanced Death Domain - Corrupting Spells, Level 9
description: Whenever you kill an enemy with your Dark damage, you can heal yourself or an ally within range of the spell for half the amount of damage dealt

name: Life Domain Spells
description: At each of the spellcasting levels listed on the Domain Spells chart below, you learn the spells listed. These spells are always prepared for you (if you are a caster that prepares spells), and do not count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. These spells are Divine Spells for you.
3rdLevelSpells: Aura of Vitality, Beacon of Hope

name: Novice Life Domain - Practiced Healer
description: Whenever you cast a spell to heal a creature, that creature gains additional hit points equal to your wisdom modifier + the spells level

name: Advanced Life Domain - Protective Healing
requirements: Requires Novice Life Domain - Practiced Healer, Level 4
description: Whenever you heal an ally, either you or your target (your choice) gains a number of temporary hit points equal to the amount of hit points restored.

name: Expert Life Domain - Flawless Healing
requirements: Requires Advanced Life Domain - Protective Healing, Level 9
description: Whenever you heal an ally, the roll for the amount of hit points restored is always the max value of the roll.

name: Light Domain Spells
description: At each of the spellcasting levels listed on the Domain Spells chart below, you learn the spells listed. These spells are always prepared for you (if you are a caster that prepares spells), and do not count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. These spells are Divine Spells for you.
4thLevelSpells: Guardian of Faith, Wall of Fire

name: Novice Light Domain - Warding Flare
description:
Whenever you are attacked by a creature within 30 feet of you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll, causing a sudden flare of light to erupt between you. A creature that can't be blinded is immune to this feature. 

You also learn the light cantrip if you don't already know it.

name: Advanced Light Domain - Mobile Flare
requirements: Requires Novice Light Domain - Warding Flare, Level 4
description: You can now use your warding flare reaction whenever one of your allies is attacked. Additionally, the blinding effect lasts until the end of the target's turn.

name: Expert Light Domain - Corona of Light
requirements: Requires Advanced Light Domain - Mobile Flare, Level 7
description: You can use an action to emit an aura of sunlight that lasts for one minute or until you dismiss it. You emit bright light in a 60 foot radius, and dim light another 30 feet beyond that. Any enemies inside the aura of light have disadvantage against any saving throws caused by spells that deal Light or Fire damage.

name: Nature Domain Spells
description: At each of the spellcasting levels listed on the Domain Spells chart below, you learn the spells listed. These spells are always prepared for you (if you are a caster that prepares spells), and do not count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. These spells are Divine Spells for you.

name: Novice Nature Domain - Primal Practitioner
description: You learn a cantrip of your choice from the Primal Spell List, and gain a skill increase in the Nature Skill. If you are proficient in a form of spellcasting, this spell is of that type.

name: Advanced Nature Domain - Warded from the Elements
requirements: Requires Novice Nature Domain - Primal Practitioner, Level 4
description: Whenever an ally of yours within 30 feet of you takes elemental damage (acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder) you can use your reaction to grant that ally resistance to that damage.

name: Expert Nature Domain - Nature's Ally
requirements: Requires Advanced Nature Domain - Warded from the Elements, Level 9
description: As an action, you can force each Beast or Plant creature within 30 feet that can see you to make a Will save against your Ability DC. If a creature fails this saving throw, they are charmed by you for 1 minute or until they take damage from you or an ally. While these creatures are charmed, you can spend an action to individually command each of them what to do on their next turn.

name: Order Domain Spells
description: At each of the spellcasting levels listed on the Domain Spells chart below, you learn the spells listed. These spells are always prepared for you (if you are a caster that prepares spells), and do not count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. These spells are Divine Spells for you.

name: Novice Order Domain - Commanding Influence
description: Whenever you target an ally with a spell, they can use their reaction to make a single weapon attack against an enemy within range.

name: Advanced Order Domain - Quick Commands
requirements: Requires Novice Order Domain - Commanding Influence, Level 4
description: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you can reduce its casting time by 1 action (to a minimum of 1 action).

name: Expert Order Domain - Lead the Masses
requirements: Requires Advanced Order Domain - Quick Commands, Level 9
description: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you can target one additional target, provided both targets are within range.

name: Tempest Domain Spells
description: At each of the spellcasting levels listed on the Domain Spells chart below, you learn the spells listed. These spells are always prepared for you (if you are a caster that prepares spells), and do not count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. These spells are Divine Spells for you.

name: Novice Tempest Domain - Storm's Rebuke
description: Whenever an enemy hits you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to force them to make a Reflex Saving Throw. The creature takes 2d8 Lightning or Thunder damage (your choice) on a failed saving throw, and half as much on a successful one.

name: Advanced Tempest Domain - Forceful Crash
requirements: Requires Novice Tempest Domain - Storm's Rebuke, Level 4
description: Whenever you deal lightning or thunder damage to a creature, you can also push them up to 10 feet in any direction (away from you)

name: Expert Tempest Domain - Storm's Lift
requirements: Requires Advanced Tempest Domain - Forceful Crash, Level 9
description: Whenever you are not indoors or underground, you have a flying speed equal to half your walking speed.

name: Trickery Domain Spells
description: At each of the spellcasting levels listed on the Domain Spells chart below, you learn the spells listed. These spells are always prepared for you (if you are a caster that prepares spells), and do not count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. These spells are Divine Spells for you.

name: Novice Trickery Domain - Hidden Blessing
description: You can spend an action to touch another creature and bless them for one hour. While blessed, that creature has advantage on all Stealth checks. You can bless one creature at any given time.

name: Advanced Trickery Domain - Now You See Me
requirements: Requires Novice Trickery Domain - Hidden Blessing, Level 4,
description: As two actions, you can make yourself invisible until the end of your next turn. You lose this effect if you make an attack or cast a spell while invisible. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your spellcasting modifier per day.

name: Expert Trickery Domain - Perfect Copy
requirements: Requires Advanced Trickery Domain - Now You See Me, Level 9
description:
As an action, you create a perfect illusion of yourself that lasts for 1 minute, or until you lose your concentration (as if you were concentrating on a spell). The illusion appears in an unoccupied space that you can see within 30 feet of you. As an action on your turn, you can move the illusion up to 30 feet to a space you can see, but it must remain within 120 feet of you.

For the duration, you can cast spells as though you were in the illusion's space, but you must use your own senses. Additionally, when both you and your illusion are within 5 feet of a creature that can see the illusion, you have advantage on attack rolls against that creature, given how distracting the illusion is to the target.

name: War Domain Spells
description: At each of the spellcasting levels listed on the Domain Spells chart below, you learn the spells listed. These spells are always prepared for you (if you are a caster that prepares spells), and do not count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. These spells are Divine Spells for you.

name: Novice War Domain - We Hold
description: Whenever you score a critical hit or kill an enemy, you and allies within 10 feet of you gain temporary hit points equal to your Wisdom Modifier.

name: Expert War Domain - Guided Strikes
requirements: Requires Novice War Domain - We Hold, Level 7
description: You can add your Wisdom modifier to your attack rolls with melee weapons.

name: Cunning Action
description: Once on each of your turns, you can take one of the Hide, Step, or Stride actions as a free action.

name: Elusive
description: No attack roll has advantage against you unless you are incapacitated.

name: Evasion
description: When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Reflex saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

name: Expert
description: You gain a number of skill increases equal to your intelligence modifier. Each time your intelligence modifier increases, you gain an additional skill increase.

name: Nimble
description: Your walking speed increases by 10 feet, and you gain a swimming and climbing speed of 15 feet. If you already have a swimming or climbing speed, those speeds increase by 5 feet instead.

name: Remarkable Reflexes
description: On the first round of combat you can take 2 turns. The first turn is taken on your initiative, and the second is taken at your initiative -10. You cannot use this feature if you are surprised.

name: Stroke of Luck
description: Once per day, you can turn a single missed weapon attack into a hit, or a single ability check roll into a natural 20.

name: Uncanny Dodge
description: When an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to halve the attack's damage against you.

name: Novice Arcane Trickster - Mage Hand Expert
description:
You learn the Mage Hand and Minor Illusion cantrips from the Arcane spell list. If you already know one or both of these cantrips, you learn one of your choice instead.

Additionally, you have improved control over the mage hand cantrip (like picking pockets and disarming traps), and can turn the hand invisible at will. You can perform tasks without being noticed by making a successful Thievery check against your target's Perception check.

name: Advanced Arcane Trickster - Look at the Hand
requirements: Requires Novice Arcane Trickster - Mage Hand Expert, Level 3
description: You can an action to use your mage hand to distract enemies, giving yourself advantage on all attacks against them until the start of your next turn

name: Expert Arcane Trickster - Spell Theif
requirements: Requires Advanced Arcane Trickster - Look at the Hand, Level 7
description:
When an enemy attempts to cast a spell, you can use your reaction to attempt to steal the knowledge of the spell from them. You force the enemy caster to make a check using their Spell Proficiency against your Ability DC. If they succeed, they cast the spell as normal and are immune to this effect for 24 hours. If they fail, their spell fizzles and you gain a single charge of their spell that you can use to cast the spell without expending a spell slot. This charge expires at the end of your next Rest. 

You cannot attempt to steal a spell while you have a stored spell charge.

name: Novice Assassin - Ambush
description: Whenever you attack an enemy that has not acted yet in combat, you have advantage on the attack roll. Additionally, any successful attack against an enemy that hasn't acted yet in combat is an automatic critical hit.

name: Advanced Assassin - Infiltrator
description:
You can spend a week crafting a false identity for yourself. You can't establish an identity that already belongs to someone else. Thereafter, if you adopt the identity as a disguise, other creatures believe you to be that person until you give them a reason not to.

You gain the ability to unerringly mimic another person's speech, writing, and behavior. You must spend at least three hours studying these three components of the person's behavior, listening to speech, examining handwriting, and observing mannerisms.

Your ruse is indiscernible to the casual observer. This removes the restriction from the above ability to copy an already existing persona (However a close ally will spot your ruse).

name: Expert Assassin - Coup De Grace
description: When you hit an enemy with an attack and it is surprised (or who hasn't acted yet in this combat) It must make a Fortitude saving throw against your Ability DC or your attack deals double damage (including any critical hit damage).

name: Novice Mastermind - Act the Part
description: You can cast the spell Disguise Self a number of times per day equal to your Charisma modifier. This action does not count as casting a spell for you. Additionally, you can spend 10 minutes observing a creature (must be able to hear them) to be able to mimic their speech patterns and accent, able to pass yourself off as a native speaker.

name: Expert Mastermind - Help from Afar
requirements: Requires Novice Mastermind - Act the Part, Level 3
description: You can spend an action to grant a creature within 30 feet of you advantage on a single attack, ability check, or saving throw.

name: Expert Mastermind - Nope, Not Me
requirements: Requires Advanced Mastermind - Help from Afar, Level 7
description: When you are attacked and there is another enemy or ally within 5 feet of you, you can spend your reaction to cause the attack to target them instead.

name: Novice Poisoner - Poisoner's Vial
description:
You gain a Poisoner's Vial, a special device used to store poisons. During each Rest, you brew a potent poison and store it in your Poisoner's Vial. You create a number of doses of poison equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1), and these doses last until you next brew and refill your Vial. 

You can use two actions to coat a single blade or a handful of arrows (5) in this poison. Whenever an enemy ingests or is damaged by a slashing or piercing weapon coating in this poison, they must make a Fortitude saving throw against a DC 9 + your level + your intelligence modifier or take 1d4 Poison damage.

name: Advanced Poisoner - Custom Toxins
requirements: Requires Novice Poisoner - Poisoner's Vial, Level 3
description:
You gain the ability to customize your poisons. Your poison's damage dice increases to 1d6, and it gains one of the following effects:

- Slowing: target's move speed is reduced by 10 feet

- Dizzying: target's next saving throw is made with disadvantage

name: Expert Poisoner - Magical Toxins
requirements: Requires Advanced Poisoner - Custom Toxins, Level 7
description:
Your proficiency with Poisons increases. You can now use a single action to apply your poison to a single sword blade, a pair of daggers, or a quiver of arrows (10).

You gain the ability to infuse magical reagents into your poisons, granting them increasingly potent effects. Choose one of the effects below, on a failed save the target of your poison's suffer its effect:

- Blinding - target loses vision for 1 round 

- Charming - target is charmed by you for 1 hour or until you or one of your allies takes hostile action against it. 

- Paralytic -target loses its next two actions

name: Novice Ruffian - Anything Will Do
description: You gain proficiency in Medium armor. In addition, you can use your sneak attack with unarmed attacks, or attacks with any simple or improvised weapon (instead of just finesse weapons.

name: Advanced Ruffian - Gut Punch
requirements: Requires Novice Ruffian - Anything Will Do, Level 3
description: When you use an action to intimidate an enemy you can see, they must make a Will saving throw against your Ability DC. If you have hit them with your sneak attack since the end of their last turn, they have disadvantage on the saving throw. On a failed saving throw, they are Frightened until the end of their next turn.

name: Expert Ruffian - Crippling Strikes
requirements: Requires Advanced Ruffian - Gut Punch, Level 7
description: When you hit an enemy with an unarmed, improvised, or bludgeoning attack and trigger your sneak attack damage, the damage from your attack ignores all armor or physical resistances.

name: Novice Scout - On the Move
description:
When an enemy ends their turn within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to take the Step action

Your walking speed increases by 5 feet, and you gain a swimming and climbing speed of 15 feet. If you already have a swimming or climbing speed, those speeds increase by 5 feet instead.

name: Advanced Scout - Forward Operator
requirements: Requires Novice Scout - On the Move, Initiative 6
description: You have advantage on initiative rolls. Whenever you make an attack roll during the first round of combat against an enemy that hasn't acted yet, your attack roll has advantage.

name: Expert Scout - Clear the Camp
requirements: Requires Advanced Scout - Forward Operator, Level 7
description: You can use your sneak attack twice per turn, instead of once, though you cannot use it against the same enemy twice in one turn.

name: Novice Swashbuckler - En Guarde
description: Your skill as a fencer has allowed you to shut down an opponents offensive. When you hit an enemy with a melee attack, they are incapable of making attacks of opportunity against you until the start of your next turn.

name: Advanced Swashbuckler - Taunting Bravado
requirements: Requires Novice Swashbuckler - En Guarde, Level 3
description:
You can spend an action to make a Persuasion or Performance check contested by your chosen target's Insight check.
