If you succeed, the chosen target has disadvantage on all attacks that do not target you, and cannot make attacks of opportunity against enemies other than you. This effect lasts for one minute, or until one of your allies affects them with an attack or spell.

If you attempt this action against a target who is not hostile to you and succeed, then they are Charmed by you for 1 minute.

name: Expert Swashbuckler - Panache
requirements: Requires Advanced Swashbuckler - Taunting Bravado, Level 7
description: You can add your Charisma modifier to your initiative rolls.

name: Spellblade Spellcasting Increase
description: Your spellcasting level increases by 1. You can take this perk multiple times, and each time you do so your spellcasting level increases by 1. You may not take this perk if it would cause your spellcasting level to be higher than your character level.

name: Arcane Propulsion
description: Your movement speed increases by 10 feet, and your jump height and length increase by 10 feet.

name: Durable Magic
identity: Spellblade, Arcanist, Priest, Wildling, Champion, Warden, Bard
description: While you maintain concentration on a spell you have a +2 Bonus to Defense and all saving throws

name: Enchanted Blade
description: You enchant a melee weapon, allowing you to magically enhance your abilities with it. You can use your Intelligence modifier for attack rolls with this weapon instead of Strength or Dexterity. You can only have one weapon enchanted this way at one time.

name: Enhanced Shield
description: You can cast the shield spell as a reaction to an area of effect spell, and can add its bonus to Reflex or Fortitude saving throws that result from such spells.

name: Spell Scholar
description: You learn a number of spells equal to your spellcasting level. Each time your spellcasting level increases, you learn an additional spell. If your form of spellcasting requires you to prepare spells, these spells are always prepared for you and do not count against your number of spells prepared.

name: Novice Bastion - Arcane Defense
description: You can use your arcane prowess to weave a constant magical shield around yourself. As long as you are conscious, this shield replaces your Defense calculation with the following formula: 9 + your level + your intelligence modifier + any defense bonuses from armor, your Stuck Defense calculation with: 9 + your level + your intelligence modifier + any defense bonuses from armor, and your touch defense to: 9 +dexterity modifier + your level.

name: Advanced Bastion - Bulwark's Defense
requirements: Requires Novice Bastion - Arcane Defense, Level 3
description: You gain the ability to momentarily protect allies near you with your arcane shield. When one of your allies within 10 feet is attacked, you can spend your reaction to add your intelligence modifier to their defense value until the end of the attacker's turn.

name: Expert Bastion - The Wall
requirements: Requires Advanced Bastion - Bulwark's Defense, Level 7
description: Your arcane shield grows in size and strength. As an action you can grant all allies within 15 feet your arcane defense instead of their standard defense calculation. This effect lasts until the beginning of your next turn.

name: Novice Artillerist - Wand Master
description:
You are a master of wands and their use. In your downtime, you can craft a wand as long as you have a sharp instrument and a bit of wood. Additionally, whenever you use a wand to cast a spell and roll a one on any of the damage dice, you can re-roll those dice. You must keep the new roll.

You learn the spell Magic Missile. It is always prepared for you if you have to prepare spells, though it isn't counted against your number of spells prepared.

name: Advanced Artillerist - Efficient Missiles
requirements: Requires Novice Artillerist - Wand Master, Level 3
description: You have begun to master the spell Magic Missile. Whenever you cast Magic Missile, the effect of the spell is determined as if you spent an additional action to cast it (maximum of 3 actions).

name: Expert Artillerist - Overwhelming Barrage
requirements: Requires Advanced Artillerist - Efficient Missiles, Level 7
description: You have complete mastery over your barrage of missiles. Whenever you cast the spell Magic Missile and spend at least two actions, the spell is cast at 1 level higher than the level you cast it at.

name: Warden Spellcasting Increase
description: Your spellcasting level increases by 1. You can take this perk multiple times, and each time you do so your spellcasting level increases by 1. You may not take this perk if it would cause your spellcasting level to be higher than your character level.

name: Companion Training
description: When you take the Command an Animal action on your turn, your companion gains 3 actions to use rather than 2.

name: Fade Away
description: You can use an action to become invisible, along with any equipment you are wearing or carrying, for one minute. This effect ends early if you cast a spell or take any hostile action. You can use this ability once per day.

name: Feral Senses
description:
When you attack a creature you can't see, your inability to see it doesn't impose disadvantage on your attack rolls against it.

You are also aware of the location of any invisible creature within 30 feet of you, provided that you aren't blinded or deafened.

name: Lands Stride
description: Difficult terrain doesn't cost you any extra feet of movement. You have advantage on any save against a spell that attempts to hinder your movement.

name: Precision Aim
description: You can add your Wisdom Modifier to the attack rolls of any weapon attacks you make against a target marked with your Hunter's Mark.

name: Predator's Insight
description: You can use your Hunter's Mark to mark a target outside of combat, allowing you to study their mannerisms and gain insight into their behaviors. If you spend a minute studying your target you gain advantage on all Insight, Deception, or Persuasion checks against them.

name: Targeted Weaknesses
description: You can add your Wisdom Modifier to the damage rolls of any weapon attacks you make against a target marked with your Hunter's Mark.

name: Rover
description: Your walking speed increases by 5, and you gain a climbing speed and a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

name: Connecting Mark
description: You can use the magic of your hunters mark to track your quarry over extraordinary distances. As long as your marked target is on the same plane as you and is not hidden from Divination magic, you can sense the direction of your marked target.

name: Hunter Conclave Spells
description: At each of the spellcasting levels listed on the Conclave Spells chart below, you learn the spells listed. These spells are always prepared for you (if you are a caster that prepares spells), and do not count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. These spells are Primal Spells for you.
2ndLevelSpells: Cordon of Arrows, Locate Animals or Plants

name: Novice Hunter - Focus
description: Once per turn when you hit an enemy marked by your Hunter's mark with an attack, you can add an additional Hunter's Mark dice to the damage roll of the attack.

name: Advanced Hunter - Surrounded
description: When you spend an action to mark an enemy with your Hunter's Mark, you can mark a second enemy as part of the same action.

name: Advanced Hunter - Hunter's Defense
description:
You gain the following benefits

- You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened. 

- Opportunity attacks against you are made with disadvantage

You can use your reaction to give yourself advantage on a Reflex Saving Throw

name: Fade Walker Conclave Spells
description: At each of the spellcasting levels listed on the Conclave Spells chart below, you learn the spells listed. These spells are always prepared for you (if you are a caster that prepares spells), and do not count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. These spells are Primal Spells for you.
1stLevelSpells: Protection from the Unnatural, Zephyr Strike

name: Novice Fade Walker - Fade Wound
description: Whenever you mark an enemy with your Hunter's Mark, you mark them in the ethereal plane as well. Each of your attacks against this target is converted into Arcane damage, and once per round you can do an additional dice of your hunter's mark damage to this target.

name: Advanced Fade Walker - Step Out and In
requirements: Requires Novice Fade Walker - Fade Wound, Level 3
description: As an action, you can cast the spell Etherealness without expending a spell charge. This spell ends at the end of your next turn, unless you will it to end early.

name: Expert Fade Walker - Fade Strikes
requirements: Requires Advanced Fade Walker - Step Out and In, Level 7
description: When you use the attack action, you can teleport up to 15 feet directly before each attack to an unoccupied space that you can see. If you attack two different targets with separate attacks, you can make a 3rd attack as a free action and without suffering the multiattack penalty, provided it targets a different enemy than the first two attacks.

name: Night Stalker Conclave Spells
description: At each of the spellcasting levels listed on the Conclave Spells chart below, you learn the spells listed. These spells are always prepared for you (if you are a caster that prepares spells), and do not count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. These spells are Primal Spells for you.

name: Novice Night Stalker - One With The Dark
description: You have magical darkvision to a range of 60 feet, and are invisible to other creatures relying on darkvision or low-light vision to see.

name: Advanced Night Stalker - Bring The Dark
requirements: Requires Novice Night Stalker - One With The Dark, Level 3
description: As an action, you can turn yourself invisible until the end of your next turn. This invisibility ends early if you cast a spell, make an attack, or otherwise engage in a hostile activity.

name: Expert Night Stalker - Always Elusive
requirements: Requires Advanced Night Stalker - Bring The Dark, Level 7
description: Whenever a creature makes an attack against you and doesn't have advantage, you can use your reaction to force the creature to make that attack with disadvantage.

name: Drakewarden Conclave Spells
description: At each of the spellcasting levels listed on the Conclave Spells chart below, you learn the spells listed. These spells are always prepared for you (if you are a caster that prepares spells), and do not count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. These spells are Primal Spells for you.

name: Novice Drakewarden - Dragonling
description:
You have guardianship over a tiny dragon familiar that is bound to you. This dragon acts in the same way as a familiar summoned by the find familiar spell, except it is of the type: dragon, its size is tiny, and it cannot be shunted away into a pocket dimension. Your dragon speaks and understands Draconic, and your bond with this dragon allows you to do so as well, if you couldn't already.

If you opt to take the Beast Companion feature as part of your Wildling's choice, your dragon grows into a young companion, and you gain access to the following form for your animal companion:

Drake

+1 Str

+1 Dex

+4 Int

Health: Your Level * (Con + 6)

Land Speed: 30

Fly Speed: 30

Defense 13 + Dex Modifier + level

Armor: (level/2)

Immune to damage of its same element

Melee attack: Bite, Str + level to hit, 1d6 + Str slashing damage + INT damage of its element

name: Advanced Drakewarden - Dragon's Breath
requirements: Requires Novice Drakewarden - Dragonling, Animal Companion, Level 3
description:
Your companion gains access to the following ability if it is Mature or older. This ability is in addition to the companion abilities normally granted by their progression.

Elemental Breath - 2 Actions - Your companion breathes its element in a 20 foot cone, forcing each creature in the area to make a Fortitude save against your Ability DC or suffer 6d6 damage of that element. Creatures who succeed on the saving throw take half damage.

name: Expert Drakewarden - Elemental Bond
requirements: Requires Advanced Drakewarden - Dragon's Breath, Level 7
description: Whenever you or the drake takes damage of an elemental type, the drake can spend their reaction to grant you or themselves resistance to that damage until the end of the round.

name: Fighting Style
description:
You gain a fighting style from the list. You can take this feat up to twice.

You cannot take it a second time until 5th level or higher.

name: Maneuver Master
description: You learn an additional Ability Feature. You can take this feature as many times as you desire.

name: Indomitable
description: When you fail a saving throw, you can choose to succeed instead. You can take this feat a second time at level 5 or higher, and a 3rd time at level 8 or higher

name: Improved Critical
description: Your critical threshold decreases by 1

name: Superior Critical
description: Your critical threshold decreases by 1

name: Survivor
description: At the start of each of your turns, if you have no more than half of your hit points left, you regain hit points equal to 5 + your Constitution modifier.

name: Novice Arcane Archer - Arcane Shot
description:
You learn how to infuse your arrows with magical energy. You learn the Prestidigitation or Druidcraft cantrip.

Additionally, you learn two of the Arcane Shot options from the Arcane Shot Options List. You can use your Arcane Shot ability a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier. 

You regain all expended uses of this ability at the end of each Rest.

name: Advanced Arcane Archer - Curved Shot
requirements: Requires Novice Arcane Archer - Arcane Shot, Level 3
description:
You learn how to direct an errant arrow toward a new target. When you make an attack roll with a magic arrow and miss, you can use a bonus action to reroll the attack roll against a different target within 60 feet of the original target.

Additionally, you learn another Arcane Shot option from the Arcane Shot Options List.

name: Expert Arcane Archer - Empowered Shot
requirements: Requires Advanced Arcane Archer - Curved Shot, Level 7
description: You learn three more Arcane Shot options from the Arcane Shot Options List. Each of your Arcane Shots is now Empowered.

name: Novice Cavalier - Mounted Warrior
description:
You gain a skill increase in one of the following skills: Animal Handling, History, Insight, Performance, or Persuasion.

Additionally, you have advantage on saving throws made to avoid falling off your mount. If you fall off your mount and aren't airborne, you can land on your feet if you're not incapacitated.

Finally, mounting or dismounting a creature doesn't cost you an action if you do so as part of a Stride Action. If you spend an action to mount a creature, you can command your mount to Stride as part of that action.

name: Advanced Cavalier - Warding Mark
requirements: Requires Novice Cavalier - Mounted Warrior, Level 3
description:
When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, you can mark the creature until the end of your next turn. This effect ends early if you are incapacitated or you die, or if someone else marks the creature.

While it is within 5 feet of you, a creature marked by you has disadvantage on any attack roll that doesn't target you (including your mount).

In addition, if a creature marked by you deals damage to anyone other than you, you can make a special melee weapon attack against the marked creature as a reaction. You have advantage on the attack roll, and if it hits, the attack's weapon deals extra damage to the target equal to your level.

name: Advanced Cavalier - Run Them Down
requirements: Requires Novice Cavalier - Mounted Warrior, Level 3
description: You can run down your foes, whether you're mounted or not. If you move at least 10 feet in a straight line right before attacking a creature and you hit it with the attack, that target must succeed on a Fortitude saving throw against your Ability DC or be knocked prone. You can use this feature only once on each of your turns.

name: Novice Samurai - Fighting Spirit
description:
You gain a skill increase in one of the following skills: History, Insight, Performance, or Persuasion. Alternatively, you learn two languages of your choice. Additionally, you gain the following action:

Fighting Spirit: As an action, you can give yourself advantage on all weapon attack rolls until the end of the current turn. When you do so, you also gain 5 temporary hit points. The number of hit points increases when you reach certain levels in this class, increasing to 10 at 4th level and 15 at 8th level.

You can use this ability a number of times equal to _ your Constitution Modifier. You regain all expended uses of it when you finish a Rest

name: Advanced Samurai - Perceptive Discipline
requirements: Requires Novice Samurai - Fighting Spirit, Level 3
description:
Your discipline and attention to detail allow you to excel in social situations. Whenever you make a Persuasion, Deception, or Society check, you gain a bonus to the check equal to your Wisdom modifier.

When you roll initiative and have no uses of Fighting Spirit remaining, you regain one use.

name: Expert Samurai - Delayed Defeat
requirements: Requires Advanced Samurai - Perceptive Discipline, Level 7
description:
If you take damage that reduces you to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to delay falling unconscious, and you take an extra turn immediately after the current one. While you have 0 hit points during that extra turn, taking damage causes death saving throw failures as normal, and three death saving throw failures can still kill you. When the extra turn ends, you fall unconscious if you still have 0 hit points.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a Rest.

name: Wildling Spellcasting Increase
description: Your spellcasting level increases by 1. You can take this perk multiple times, and each time you do so your spellcasting level increases by 1. You may not take this perk if it would cause your spellcasting level to be higher than your character level.

name: Fey Companion
description: You gain a Familiar Companion without having to cast the Find Familiar spell. Its type is Fey, and it can change its shape as will. If it should perish, you can touch it and expend a spell charge of 1st level or higher to return it to full hit points.

name: Beast Spells
description: You can cast spells while shapechanged.

name: Nature's Sanctuary
description: Beasts, plant creatures, and other natural creatures are hesitant to attack you. Whenever one of these beings targets you with an attack or forces you to make a saving throw(single target only), they must first make a Will save against your Ability DC. On a successful save the creature is immune to this effect for 24 hours. On a failed save the creature must select a new target or lose the attack or effect.

name: Pest Form
description: You can use your wildshape to turn into a small or tiny sized creature. This creature can take whatever form you desire, so long as it does not have any combat statistics. While in this form your maximum hit points are reduced to equal your level.

name: Empowered Form
description: While shapechanged, your form's melee attacks deal double their base damage dice with each attack. Additionally, when you choose the Brute or Ambusher form, you can select two abilities rather than 1.

name: Monstrous Form
description: Whenever you shapechange, you can expend two uses of your ability to assume the Monstrosity form instead of the Brute or Ambusher form.

name: Primal Regeneration
description: While you are shapechanged, you can expend a spell charge to regain hit points equal to 2d8 * the level of the charge expended.

name: Verdant Weapon
description: You cultivate a living branch that grows and shapes itself into a weapon of your choice. You can use an action to change this weapon's shape into that of any simple melee weapon. When not in combat, your weapon takes the shape of a simple walking stick. This weapon can be used as a Primal spellcasting focus.

name: Shaman Conclave Spells
description: At each of the spellcasting levels listed on the Conclave Spells chart below, you learn the spells listed. These spells are always prepared for you (if you are a caster that prepares spells), and do not count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. These spells are Primal Spells for you.

name: Novice Shaman - Mistwalker
description: You can use an action to disappear into mist and teleport up to 60 feet away to an unoccupied space you can see. You can use this ability once per day.

name: Advanced Shaman - Elemental Protection
description: When you or an ally you can see within 30 feet is damaged by an elemental damage type, you can use your reaction to grant them (or yourself) resistance to that instance of that damage type.

name: Expert Shaman - Protected by Nature
requirements: Requires Advanced Shaman - Elemental Protection, Level 7
description: When you are attacked by a natural creature, fey, elemental, or dragon, that creature must succeed on a Will saving throw against your Ability DC or be forced to change the target of its attack to a different target or the attack automatically misses.

name: Storm Speaker Conclave Spells
description: At each of the spellcasting levels listed on the Conclave Spells chart below, you learn the spells listed. These spells are always prepared for you (if you are a caster that prepares spells), and do not count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. These spells are Primal Spells for you.

name: Novice Storm Speaker - Fogling
description: You are unaffected by weather effects that obscure your vision or cause hazardous terrain. (for example fog cloud, or Rainfall)

name: Advanced Storm Speaker - Stormcaller
requirements: Requires Novice Storm Speaker - Fogling, Level 3
description: When you cast the spell call lightning, you can use two actions to both summon a lightning bolt and sustain the spell.

name: Expert Storm Speaker - Storm Unbound
requirements: Requires Advanced Storm Speaker - Stormcaller, Level 7
description: You can cast the spell Firestorm once per day without expending spell charges or spell points, and do not need to have the spell prepared to do so.

name: Swarmkeeper Conclave Spells
description: At each of the spellcasting levels listed on the Conclave Spells chart below, you learn the spells listed. These spells are always prepared for you (if you are a caster that prepares spells), and do not count against the number of spells you can prepare each day. These spells are Primal Spells for you.

name: Novice Swarmkeeper - Swarm
description:
You have a swarm of tiny beasts or fey spirits that are constantly about your person. Once per round when you make an attack against an enemy, you can command the swarm as a free action to:

- Deal 1d4 slashing, piercing, or bludgeoning damage to your target (chosen when your swarm type is chosen) (only after you successfully hit an enemy with an attack)

- The attack's target must succeed on a Fortitude saving throw against your Ability DC or be moved by the swarm up to 15 feet horizontally in a direction of your choice (only after you successfully hit an enemy with an attack).

You are moved by the swarm 5 feet horizontally in a direction of your choice. If this movement would provoke an attack of opportunity, the attack is made with disadvantage.

name: Advanced Swarmkeeper - Defensive Swarm
description:
The swarm's strength increases, increasing its damage to 1d8. Additionally, if a creature fails its saving throw against being moved by the swarm you force the creature to be knocked prone instead.

You also gain the following swarm option:

- You can cause the swarm to take up a defensive shroud around you, granting you half-cover until the beginning of your next turn.

name: Expert - Massive Swarm
requirements: Requires Advanced Swarmkeeper - Defensive Swarm, Level 7
description:
Your swarm has grown massive, allowing you to be completely hidden for brief periods. Its damage increases to 2d6, and when you command your swarm to grant you cover, you are now granted 3/4 cover until the start of your next turn.

You also gain the following ability: you can use your reaction to grant yourself resistance to a single instance of damage, dispersing it throughout your swarm instead

name: Pact Boon - Bound Blade
requirements: Requires a binding pact with a powerful Patron, Charisma 14
description:
Bound Blade

-- You can use an action to create a bound weapon in your empty hand. You can choose the form that this melee weapon takes each time you create it. You are proficient with it while you wield it. This weapon counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistances.

-- Your bound weapon disappears if it is more than 5 feet away from you for 1 minute or more. It also disappears if you use this feature again, if you dismiss the weapon (no action required), or if you die.

-- You can transform one magic weapon into your pact weapon by performing a special ritual while you hold the weapon. You perform the ritual over the course of 1 hour, which can be done during a short rest.

-- You can then dismiss the weapon, shunting it into an extradimensional space, and it appears whenever you create your pact weapon thereafter. You can't affect an artifact or a sentient weapon in this way. The weapon ceases being your pact weapon if you die, if you perform the 1-hour ritual on a different weapon, or if you use a 1-hour ritual to break your bond to it. The weapon appears at your feet if it is in the extradimensional space when the bond breaks.

name: Pact Boon - Grimoire
requirements: Requires a binding pact with a powerful Patron, Charisma 14
description:
Grimoire

-- Your patron gives you a grimoire called a Book of Shadows. When you gain this feature, choose three cantrips from any spell list (they don't have to be the same list). While the book is on your person, you can cast those cantrips at will. Charisma is your spellcasting modifier for these spells, and they are considered Arcane spells for you. 

-- If you lose your Book of Shadows, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony to receive a replacement from your patron. This ceremony can be performed during a short or long rest, and it destroys the previous book. The book turns to ash when you die.

name: Pact Boon - Chain
requirements: Requires a binding pact with a powerful Patron, Charisma 14
description:
Chain

-- You learn the Find Familiar spell and can cast it without expending any spell charges or spell points.

-- Your familiar can change its shape at will, and is not limited to beast shapes like other familiars..

-- Additionally, whenever you cast a spell, you can choose to have the spell originate from you or from your familiar.

name: Gifted Spellcasting
requirements: Requires a binding pact with a powerful Patron, Charisma 14
description:
Choose a spell list associated with your Patron (Arcane, Divine, Primal). You become a 1st level Pact Spellcaster. This spellcasting level is NOT cumulative with any other spellcasting level types or increases. 

Each day, you have a number of castings of these spells equal to your Charisma Modifier (total, not per spell). When you cast one of these spells, it is automatically upcast to the level specified on the Spells Cast at Level column on the Pact spellcasting chart.

Each time you take this Feature, your Pact Spellcasting ability increases by 1 level, and you learn new spells as shown on the Spells Known column of the Pact Spellcasting chart. These spells can be of any level up to your spellcasting level (a 2nd level pact spellcaster can know 1st and 2nd level spells).

name: Ancient One Pact - Awakened Mind
requirements: Requires a Pact with an Ancient One
description: Your alien knowledge gives you the ability to touch the minds of other creatures. You can communicate telepathically with any creature you can see within 30 feet of you. You don't need to share a language with the creature for it to understand your telepathic utterances, but the creature must be able to understand at least one language.

name: Ancient One Pact - Entropic Ward
requirements: Requires a Pact with an Ancient One
description:
You learn to magically ward yourself against attack and to turn an enemy's failed strike into good luck for yourself. When a creature makes an attack roll against you, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on that roll. If the attack misses you, your next attack roll against the creature has advantage if you make it before the end of your next turn.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a Rest.

name: Ancient One Pact - Thought Shield
requirements: Requires a Pact with an Ancient One
description: Your thoughts can't be read by telepathy or other means unless you allow it. You also have resistance to psychic damage, and whenever a creature deals psychic damage to you, that creature takes the same amount of damage that you do.

name: Ancient One Pact - Create Thrall
requirements: Requires a Pact with an Ancient One, Level 7
description:
You gain the ability to infect a humanoid's mind with the alien magic of your patron. You can use your action to touch an incapacitated humanoid. That creature is then charmed by you until a Remove Curse spell is cast on it, the charmed condition is removed from it, or you use this feature again.

You can communicate telepathically with the charmed creature as long as the two of you are on the same plane of existence.

name: Celestial Pact - Light Bringer
requirements: Requires a Pact with a Celestial
description: You learn the Light and Sacred Flame, and Divine Lance cantrips.

name: Celestial Pact - Healing Light
requirements: Requires a Pact with a Celestial
description:
You have a pool of d6s that you spend to fuel this healing. The number of dice in the pool equals your level.

As an action, you can heal one creature you can see within 30 feet of you, spending dice from the pool. The maximum number of dice you can spend at once equals your Charisma modifier (minimum of one die). Roll the dice you spend, add them together, and restore a number of hit points equal to the total.

Your pool regains all expended dice when you finish a Rest.

name: Celestial Pact - Radiant Soul
requirements: Requires a Pact with a Celestial
description: Your link to the Celestial allows you to serve as a conduit for radiant energy. You have resistance to Light damage, and when you cast a spell that deals Light or Fire damage, you add your (Charisma or Intelligence) modifier to one Light or Fire damage roll of that spell against one of its targets.

name: Celestial Pact - Celestial Resistance
requirements: Requires a Pact with a Celestial
description: You gain temporary hit points whenever you finish a Rest. These temporary hit points equal your level + your Charisma Modifier. Additionally, choose up to five creatures you can see at the end of the rest. Those creatures each gain temporary hit points equal to half your level + your Charisma modifier.

name: Celestial Pact - Searing Vengeance
requirements: Requires a Pact with a Celestial, Level 7
description:
When you have to make a death saving throw at the start of your turn, you can instead spring back to your feet with a burst of radiant energy. You regain hit points equal to half your hit point maximum, and then you stand up if you so choose. Each creature of your choice that is within 30 feet of you takes Light damage equal to 2d8 + your Charisma modifier, and is blinded until the end of the current turn.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

name: Demonic Pact - Dark One's Hunger
requirements: Requires a Pact with a Demon
description: When you reduce a hostile creature to 0 hit points, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Charisma Modifier + your level.

name: Demonic Pact - Dark One's Blessing
requirements: Requires a Pact with a Demon
description:
You can call on your patron to alter fate in your favor. When you make an ability check or a saving throw, you can use this feature to add a d10 to your roll. You can do so after seeing the initial roll but before any of the roll's effects occur.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a Rest.

name: Demonic Pact - Fiendish Resilience
requirements: Requires a Pact with a Demon
description: You can choose one damage type when you finish a Rest. You gain resistance to that damage type until you choose a different one with this feature. Damage from magical weapons or silver weapons ignores this resistance.

name: Demonic Pact - Hurl Through Hell
requirements: Requires a Pact with a Demon, Level 7
description:
When you hit a creature with an attack, you can use this feature to instantly transport the target through the lower planes. The creature disappears and hurtles through a nightmare landscape.

At the end of your next turn, the target returns to the space it previously occupied, or the nearest unoccupied space. If the target is not a fiend, it takes 10d10 psychic damage as it reels from its horrific experience.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a Rest.

name: Fey pact - Fey Presence
requirements: Requires a Pact with a Fey
description:
Your patron bestows upon you the ability to project the beguiling and fearsome presence of the fey. As an action, you can cause each creature in a 10-foot cube originating from you to make a Will saving throw against your ability DC. The creatures that fail their saving throws are all charmed or frightened by you (your choice) until the end of your next turn.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a Rest.

name: Fey pact - Misty Escape
requirements: Requires a Pact with a Fey
description:
You can vanish in a puff of mist in response to harm. When you take damage, you can use your reaction to turn invisible and teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You remain invisible until the end of your next turn or until you take a hostile action.

Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a Rest.

name: Fey pact - Beguiling Defenses
requirements: Requires a Pact with a Fey
description: Your patron teaches you how to turn the mind-affecting magic of your enemies against them. You are immune to being charmed, and when another creature attempts to charm you, you can use your reaction to attempt to turn the charm back on that creature. The creature must succeed on a Will saving throw against your Ability DC or be charmed by you for 1 minute or until the creature takes any damage.

name: Fey pact - Dark Delirium
requirements: Requires a Pact with a Fey, Level 7
description:
You can plunge a creature into an illusory realm. As an action, choose a creature that you can see within 60 feet of you. It must make a Will saving throw against your Ability DC. On a failed save, it is charmed or frightened by you (your choice) for 1 minute or until your concentration is broken (as if you are concentrating on a spell). This effect ends early if the creature takes any damage.

Until this illusion ends, the creature thinks it is lost in a misty realm, the appearance of which you choose. The creature can see and hear only itself, you, and the illusion.

You must finish a Rest before you can use this feature again.

name: Hex Pact - Curse
requirements: Requires a Pact with a Profane Being
description:
As an action, choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. The target is cursed for 1 minute. The curse ends early if the target dies, you die, or you are incapacitated. Until the curse ends, you gain the following benefits:

- You can add your level to damage rolls against your cursed target.

- Your critical threshold is decreased by 1 against this target

- If the cursed target dies, you regain hit points equal to your Charisma modifier.

You can use this ability once per day.

name: Hex Pact - Hex Warrior
requirements: Requires a Pact with a Profane Being, Pact Boon - Bound Blade
description:
You gain proficiency with medium armor, shields, and martial weapons.

When you attack an enemy with your bound weapon, you can use your Charisma modifier for the attack and damage rolls.

name: Hex Pact - Cursed Soul
requirements: Requires a Pact with a Profane Being, Hex Pact - Curse
description:
When a humanoid you have cursed dies, you can cause its spirit to rise from its corpse as a specter. When the specter appears, it gains temporary hit points equal to your level. Roll initiative for the specter, which has its own turns.

It obeys your verbal commands (no actions needed), and has the following statistics: 25 hit points, defense 15, 50 foot fly speed, and has saving throws equal to your level. It has the following attack: 2 Actions - Your Charisma + your level to hit, on hit 3d6 Dark damage and the target must make a Fortitude saving throw or have its max hit points reduced by the damage taken until their next Rest.

The specter remains in your service until the end of your next Rest at which point it vanishes to the afterlife. Once you bind a specter with this feature, you can't use the feature again until you finish a Rest.

name: Hex Pact - Defensive Hex
requirements: Requires a Pact with a Profane Being, Hex Pact - Curse
description: If the target cursed by your Hexblade's Curse hits you with an attack roll, roll a d6. On a 4 or higher, the attack instead misses you, regardless of its roll.

name: Hex Pact - Curse Transfer
requirements: Requires a Pact with a Profane Being, Hex Pact - Curse, Level 5
description: You can spread your Curse from a slain creature to another creature. When the creature cursed by your Curse dies, you can apply the curse to a different creature you can see within 30 feet of you, provided you aren't incapacitated.

name: Cantrip Master
description: You learn two cantrips from a single spell list of your choice. If you already have proficiency in a type of spell, you can use the same spellcasting modifier. If you do not have proficiency in a type of spells, your casting modifier is either Intelligence, Charisma, or Wisdom (your choice). You are proficient in the casting of these Cantrips, but are not granted proficiency in other spells from the chosen spell list.

name: Arcane Spellcasting
description:
You gain the ability to cast Arcane spells using a spellcasting focus, staff, or wand. Intelligence or Charisma (your choice) is your spellcasting modifier for spells of this type and you are proficient in the casting of these spells. If you are already proficient in spellcasting, you can use the same casting modifier for these spells.

You learn 4 Spells from the Arcane spell list. You have a number of spell charges as shown below on the Universal Spell Charge chart.

You can take this ability multiple times. Each time after the first your spellcasting ability increases by 1 level, and you learn three additional Arcane spells. You cannot take this feature if it would increase your spellcasting ability to a level higher than your character level, or if you gained Arcane Spellcasting as part of your Core Identity.

name: Divine Spellcasting
description:
You gain the ability to cast Divine spells using a holy symbol, emblazoned shield, banner, or wand. Wisdom or Charisma (your choice) is your spellcasting modifier for spells of this type and you are proficient in the casting of these spells. If you are already proficient in spellcasting, you can use the same casting modifier for these spells.

You learn 4 Spells from the Divine spell list. You have a number of spell charges as shown below on the Universal Spell Charge chart.

You can take this ability multiple times. Each time after the first your spellcasting ability increases by 1 level, and you learn three additional Divine spells. You cannot take this feature if it would increase your spellcasting ability to a level higher than your character level, or if you gained Divine Spellcasting as part of your Core Identity.

name: Primal Spellcasting
description:
You gain the ability to cast Primal spells using a totem, natural focus, staff, or wand. Wisdom or Intelligence (your choice) is your spellcasting modifier for spells of this type and you are proficient in the casting of these spells. If you are already proficient in spellcasting, you can use the same casting modifier for these spells.

You learn 4 Spells from the Primal spell list. You have a number of spell charges as shown below on the Universal Spell Charge chart.

You can take this ability multiple times. Each time after the first your spellcasting ability increases by 1 level, and you learn three additional Primal spells. You cannot take this feature if it would increase your spellcasting ability to a level higher than your character level, or if you gained Primal Spellcasting as part of your Core Identity.

name: Innate Spellcasting
description:
You gain the ability to cast Arcane spells (or the type of spells granted by your Bloodline feature) using a staff, wand, or other focus. Charisma or Constitution (your choice) is your spellcasting modifier for spells of this type and you are proficient in the casting of these spells. If you are already proficient in spellcasting, you can use the same casting modifier for these spells.

You learn 4 Spells from the Arcane spell list (Unless you have the bloodline feature, in which case you learn spells from the listed granted by that feature). You have a number of spell points as shown below on the Universal Spell Points chart.

You can take this ability up to 5 times total. Each time after the first your spellcasting ability increases by 1 level, and you learn three additional Arcane spells. You cannot take this feature if it would increase your spellcasting ability to a level higher than your character level, or if you gained Arcane or Innate Spellcasting as part of your Core Identity.

name: Athlete
description:
Increase your Strength or Dexterity by 1.

When you are prone, you can stand up as part of a stride action, standing up costs you 5 feet of movement.

You gain a climbing and swimming speed of 15 feet. If you already have one of these speeds, it increases by 10 feet.

name: Actor
description:
Increase your Charisma by 1.

You have advantage of Charisma (Deception) and Charisma (Performance) checks to pass yourself off as someone else.

You can mimic the speech of another person or the sounds made by other creatures. You must have heard the speech or sound for at least 1 minute. A successful Wisdom (Insight) check contested by your Charisma (Deception) check allows a listener to determine the effect is faked.

name: Trap Expert
description:
Increase your Wisdom or Intelligence by 1.

You have advantage on Perception checks and Investigation checks made to detect the presence of secret doors.

You have advantage on saving throws made to avoid or resist traps.

You have resistance to damage dealt by traps.

You can search for traps while traveling at a normal pace.

name: Inspiring Leader
description:
Increase your Charisma by 1.

You can spend 10 minutes inspiring your companions, shoring up their will to fight. When you do so, choose up to six friendly creatures (which can include yourself) within 30 feet of you that can see or hear you and can understand you. Each creature gains temporary hit points equal to your level + your Charisma modifier. A creature can't gain temporary hit points in this way again until they finish a rest.

name: Keen Mind
description:
Increase your Intelligence by 1.

You always know which way is north.

You always know how the number of hours left before the next sunrise or sunset.

You can accurately recall anything you have seen or heard within the past month.

name: Linguist
description:
Increase your Intelligence by 1.

You learn three languages of your choice.

You can easily create written ciphers. Others cannot decipher a code you create unless you teach it to them, they succeed on an Intelligence check (DC = your Intelligence score + your level + 10), or they use magic to decipher it.

name: Observant
description:
Increase your Intelligence or Wisdom by 1.

If you can see a creature's mouth while it is speaking a language you understand, you can interpret their words by reading their lips.

You have advantage on all Perception and Investigation checks relating to observing details.

name: Skilled
description:
Increase your Intelligence by 1.

You gain 3 skill increases, and if your intelligence is 19 or greater: one additional skill increase.

name: Skulker
description:
Increase your Dexterity by 1.

You can try to hide when you are only lightly obscured from the creature from which you are hiding.

When you are hidden from a creature and miss it with a ranged weapon attack, making the attack doesn't reveal your position.

Dim light doesn't impose disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) bonuses made with sight.

name: Tough
description:
Increase your Strength or Constitution by 1

Increase your hit points by an amount equal to 2 * your current level

Each time you gain a level, you gain two additional hit points.

name: Archer
description:
Increase your Dexterity by 1.

Attacking at any range up to your weapon's maximum doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged weapon attack rolls.

Your ranged weapons ignore half cover and three-quarters cover.

name: Bludgeoning Specialist
description:
Increase your Strength by 1.

When you make an attack roll with a weapon that deals bludgeoning damage and you miss, but would have hit the target using their Touch defense, the target takes damage equal to your Strength Modifier.

When you score a critical hit with a weapon that deals bludgeoning damage, if the target is a Large-sized creature or smaller, it must succeed on a Fortitude saving throw or be knocked prone. The saving throw DC equals 9 + your level + your Strength modifier.

name: Crossbow Master
description:
Increase your Dexterity by 1.

You ignore the loading quality of crossbows with which you are proficient.

Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls.

name: Defensive Duelist
description:
Increase your Dexterity by 1.

When you are wielding a finesse weapon you are proficient with in one hand (and no other weapons) and another creature hits you with a melee attack, you can use your reaction to add your Dexterity modifier to your Defense against that attack, potentially causing it to miss.

name: Dual Wielder
description:
Increase your Dexterity by 1.

When wielding a weapon in each hand, you gain a +1 bonus to Defense and you can wield a weapon in each hand, even if the weapons aren't light.

You can draw or sheath two one-handed weapons when you take the Draw action instead of one.

name: Elemental Adept
description:
Increase your spellcasting ability score by 1.

When you gain this feat, choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. Spells you cast ignore resistance to the chosen type, and whenever you roll damage for a spell that deals damage of the chosen type, treat any rolled 1's as being a 2.

name: Firearms Apprentice
description:
Increase your Dexterity by 1.

You gain proficiency with firearms.

You may cast bullets from scrap or other metal sources as part of a rest (10 per rest)

name: Firearms Master
description:
Increase your Dexterity by 1.

You ignore the loading quality of firearms with which you are proficient.

Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged attack rolls.

Attacking at any range up to your weapon's maximum doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged weapon attack rolls.

name: Great Weapon Momentum
description: On your turn, when you score a critical hit with a two-handed melee weapon attack or reduce a creature to 0 hit points with one, you can make one melee weapon attack as a reaction. This attack is not subject to the multi-attack penalty.

name: Mage Slayer
description:
Increase your Strength or Dexterity by 1.

When a creature within your melee reach casts a spell, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against that creature.

When you damage a creature that is concentrating on a spell, they have disadvantage on the saving throw they make to maintain concentration.

You have advantage on saving throws against spells cast by creatures with your reach.

name: Mounted Combatant
description:
Your Constitution increases by 1.

You have advantage on melee attack rolls against unmounted creatures that are the same size or smaller than your mount.

You can force an attack targeted at your mount to target you instead.

If your mount is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Reflex save to take only half damage, it takes no damage if it succeeds and half damage if it fails.

name: Piercing Specialist
description:
Increase your Dexterity by 1.

Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a weapon attack that deals piercing damage, you can reroll one of the attack's damage dice, and you must use the new roll.

When you score a critical hit that deals piercing damage to a creature, you can roll one additional damage die when determining the extra piercing damage the target takes.

name: Polearm Chargebreaker
description: While wielding a polearm (glaive, halberd, pike, quarterstaff, spear,trident, etc), other creatures provoke an opportunity attack from you when they enter your reach. Successful hits with this opportunity attack deal double the number of weapon damage dice. This attack cannot gain the benefits of a critical hit.

name: Savage Attacker
description: Once per turn when you roll damage for a melee weapon attack, you can reroll the weapon's damage dice and use either total.

name: Sentinel
description:
Whenever you hit a creature with an opportunity attack, its speed drops to 0 for the rest of the turn. This stops any movement they may have been taking.

Creatures within your reach provoke opportunity attacks even if they were taking the Step action.

name: Slashing Specialist
description:
Increase your Strength or Dexterity by 1.

Once per turn when you hit a creature with an attack that deals slashing damage, you can reduce the speed of the target by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

When you score a critical hit that deals slashing damage to a creature, you grievously wound it. Until the start of your next turn, the target has disadvantage on all attack rolls.

name: War Caster
description:
You have advantage on Fortitude saves that you make to maintain concentration on a spell when you take damage.

You can use your weapon as a spellcasting focus for your spells.

When a hostile creature's movement provokes an opportunity attack from you, you can use your reaction to cast a spell at the creature, instead of making an opportunity attack. The spell must have a casting time of 1 or 2 actions and must target only that creature.

name: Shield Master
description:
You gain the following benefits while wielding a shield:

If you aren't incapacitated, you can add your shield's Defense bonus to any Reflex save made against a spell or other effect that affects only you.

If you are subjected to an effect which allows you to make a Reflex save for half damage, you can use your reaction to take no damage, interposing your shield between you and the effect.

name: Lightly Armored
description:
Increase your Strength or Dexterity by 1.

You become proficient with light armor and bucklers.

name: Moderately Armored
description:
Increase your Strength or Dexterity by 1.

You become proficient with medium armor and shields.

name: Heavily Armored
description:
Increase your Strength by 1.

You become proficient with heavy armor and tower shields

name: Light Armor Master
description:
You can wear Light armor under your clothing, concealing it.

While wearing Light armor, you can ignore Dexterity caps on your armor.

While wearing Light armor, your armor value is increased by 1.

name: Medium Armor Master
description:
Wearing medium armor doesn't impose disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

When wearing medium armor, your dexterity cap increases by 1.

When wearing medium armor, your armor value is increased by 1.

name: Heavy Armor Master
description:
Increase your Strength or Constitution by 1 .

When wearing heavy armor your armor value is increased by 3.

name: Rage
description:
As an action, you can unleash the power within yourself and enter a rage. While raging, you gain the following benefits:

- Your armor value is equal to your constitution modifier (if it is higher than your worn armor's value)

- You gain additional damage to your unarmed and melee weapon attack rolls equal to your level with the attack.

- Any additional benefits granted by identity choices

name: Inspiration
description:
You can inspire others through stirring words or music. To do so, you may use an action on your turn to choose one creature other than yourself within 60 feet of you who can hear you. That creature gains one Bardic Inspiration die, a d4.

Once within the next 10 minutes, the creature can roll the inspiration die and add the number rolled to any d20 roll. The creature can wait until after it rolls the d20 before deciding to use the Bardic Inspiration die, but must decide before the DM says whether the roll succeeds or fails. Once the Bardic Inspiration die is rolled, it is lost. A creature can have only one Bardic Inspiration die at a time.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (a minimum of once). You regain any expended uses when you finish a rest.

Your Bardic Inspiration die changes when you reach certain levels in this class. The die becomes a d6 at 3rd level, a d8 at 5th level, a d10 at 7th level, and a d12 at 9th level.

name: Smite
description: When you hit an enemy with a weapon attack, you can expend a spell charge to deal extra damage to that enemy of an elemental type of your choice (chosen at 1st level). This damage is equal to 1d8 + 1d8 per level of the spell charge.

name: Bloodline
description: You unlock latent power that has been dormant in your blood. Choose one of the Bloodlines from the Empowered Bloodline list, and gain its special ability. If you later take the Innate Spellcasting feature, your bloodline determines the spell list your innate casting grants you access to.

name: Ki
description:
You have a number of Ki points equal to your Wisdom Modifier + your level. You can use these points to activate special abilities. Your pool of Ki points completely refills at the end of each Rest. At 1st level, you have access to the following abilities:

Patient Defense

-- You can spend 2 ki points to take the Dodge action as a free action on your turn.

Step of the Wind

-- You can spend 1 ki point to take the Stride or Step action as a free action on your turn, and your jump distance is doubled for the turn.

name: Flurry of Blows
description: Immediately after you take the Attack action on your turn, you can make two unarmed strikes as a single action. These strikes do not suffer the multi-attack penalty

name: Martial Arts Dice
description:
Your discipline and practice has allowed you to hone your fighting style with certain weapons. Whenever you are wielding a simple weapon or no weapon at all, you can use your Dexterity Modifier in the place of your strength modifier for both attack and damage rolls with that weapon (or your unarmed strike).

Additionally at level one you gain a dice that can be used in place of any damage die when you make an attack with a simple weapon or unarmed attack. This damage dice is a d4 at level 1, and increases to a d6 at level 3, a d8 at level 5, a d10 at level 7, and a d12 at level 9.

name: Font of Healing and Harm
description: You have access to a Font of Healing and Harm that you can tap into. This font provides you with a number of casts of the Heal or Harm spell (cast at a level equal to _ your spellcasting level, rounded up) per day equal to your Wisdom Modifier.

name: Sneak Attack
description: You are capable of targeting your enemy's weak points to inflict massive damage. When you make an attack roll with a finesse weapon that does slashing or piercing damage against an enemy and you have advantage on the attack, or when an ally is within 5 feet of your target, you can add additional d6s of the same damage type equal to your level. You can use this ability once per turn.

name: Thieves' Knack
description: When you make an attempt at a skill check and are Untrained in that skill, you can add +2 to your skill check result.

name: Arcane Assistance
description:
Whenever you or an ally within 60 feet attempts an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can spend your reaction to magically assist in that attempt, adding your Intelligence modifier to the roll. You can add this bonus after you see the roll, but not after the DM has declared the results of the roll.

You can use this feature a number of times per day equal to your Intelligence Modifier.

name: Hunter's Mark
description: You use an action to mark a target as your prey. Whenever you hit this target with a weapon or unarmed attack, the target suffers an extra 1d4 of damage matching the type of your attack. This damage increases to 1d6 at level 3, 1d8 at level 5, 1d10 at level 7 and 1d12 at level 9.

name: Action Surge
description: You gain the following ability: You can channel your adrenaline to gain 2 additional actions and an additional reaction. These actions must be used on your current turn, but the extra reaction doesn't expire until the start of your next turn. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your Constitution Modifier. Your uses of this ability recharge each day when you complete a Rest.

name: Maneuver Dice
description:
Many of your abilities granted by the Ability Features you choose will allow you to make a check or roll damage dice. Whenever you use one of these abilities, you can add your Maneuver Dice to the d20 roll for any skill check, or to the attack or damage roll for any attack. You can only use this dice once per action.

This dice is a d4 at level 1, increases to a d6 at level 3, a d8 at level 5, a d10 at level 7, and a d12 at level 9.

name: Shapechange
description:
As a master of communion with nature, you have learned to change your form into that of a wild beast. You have a number of uses for this ability equal to your Wisdom Modifier (minimum of 1). 

As an action, you magically reshape your form to assume the shape of a beast of your choice, choosing one of the stat blocks at the end of this chapter that best fits the shape you chose (Ambusher or Brute). Your size, mental stats, and skill proficiencies stay the same, but your physical stats and abilities shift to match those of your chosen form. Your form might have bonuses listed that are added to any checks you make that they relate to. The overall appearance of the chosen form is up to you, but its abilities must match one of the provided stat blocks. You remain in this form until you use a free action to will yourself out of it, or until you Rest or are reduced to 0 hit points.

name: Empowered Upcasting
description:
Whenever you cast a spell using spell points, you can upcast the spell beyond a normal spellcaster's limits. For the purposes of upcasting, you can treat your Upcast Level as your Max Spell Level when determining how high of a level you will cast your chosen spell at, and how many spell points you will expend.

You have a number of uses of this ability equal to your Constitution modifier. You regain all expended uses of this ability at the end of a rest.

name: Young Animal Companion
requirements: You gain a young animal companion, the form of which you choose. Its stats and abilities are detailed in the Animal Companion Appendix

name: Mature Animal Companion
description: Your animal companion grows into an adult of its species, gaining benefits as it grows with you. The changes to its stats and abilities as it matures are detailed in the Animal Companion Appendix

name: Specialized Animal Companion
description: Through specialized training, your companion becomes either a Savage or Nimble Animal Companion, learning new abilities and further specializing its stats. These changes are detailed in the Animal Companion Appendix

name: Apex Animal Companion
description: Your companion reaches the height of their species, an Apex predator far beyond their natural possibilities. Their stats improve and they learn new abilities as detailed in the Animal Companion Appendix.
